Summary Heading: Don't stay if you need to leave your car after check out to go to Disneyland
Summary: Every year we come to Disneyland from SD and every year we stay at a different hotel by the entrance (Park Vue, Candy Cane, Desert Inn, Del Sol).  We arrive in the afternoon, stay the night, check out the next morning for an early start at Disney, pick our car up at end of the day and drive home.   Every other hotel near the entrance can accommodate the car there for the full day after check out, which allows us to skip the hassle and expense of Disney parking lot, shuttle and crowds.  The Best Western requires you to move your car by 6pm.  Deal breaker!    The staff are great, the rooms are fine, the pool is just right and its otherwise fine if you don't need this day of parking after you check out. Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words and staying with us.  We are looking forward to seeing real you soon.

Summary Heading: Poor Service, Outdated rooms.  The only saving grace is it's directly across from Disney.
Summary: Poor service.  Outdated rooms.  Close to Disney but far better options to explore if you're looking for updated rooms and friendly front desk staff, shop around before locking yourself into this one.   The housekeeping was wonderful. The rooms were clean.   The front desk staff and the sad ammenities left a lot to be desired
Manager Response: I would like to express my appreciation for your business and for writing a review.  Feedback is very important to me, be it good or bad.  I  apologize for the poor service you received and would hope that you would stay with us again.  By next year at this time all rooms will be newly renovated.  Our staff here at Best Western, are currently encouraged to take online training to better serve our guest.

Summary Heading: Perfect Location, Affordable Price, Comfortable Accomodations
Summary: A group of friends and I booked adjoining rooms in this Disneyland Good Neighbor Hotel due to it's proximity to the main entry gate and reasonable prices. We were all very happy with the accommodation at this hotel. From the friendly check-in staff to the comfortable beds, and the delicious variety at the included breakfast buffet, this hotel perfectly suited our needs. Hotel is on the older side, with open concrete stairs, traditional shower/tub combo bathrooms and smaller rooms sizes, but lets all be honest, you're here for Disneyland! Our adjoining rooms were convenient and we stocked our provided mini fridges full of champagnes bottles. Abundant counter top space in the bathroom included a microwave which was a nice touch. Since both rooms had 2 queen beds, there wasn't much
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.   Here at Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn, we like to give a variety of breakfast items to accommodate everyone.  We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We certainly enjoy this property when we visit Disneyland.  It is a short walking distance to the main gate.  The breakfast is a delight and starts the day off right.  The rooms are clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for writing a review.  I am so happy that you enjoyed your stay here at Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn.  We take customer service seriously and we look forward to giving every guest an enjoyable experience.

Summary: We stay at BW everytime we visit disneyland. Location is great, and so is the service. The breakfast room is awesome especially with kids. There are several options so everyone is happy and you don't have to worry about going out to eat before entering disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review.  We appreciate your kind comments and look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We arrived late, and the parking lot was full, but a maintenance guy moved his own car to make room for us.  The room was clean and comfortable.  Location couldn't be much better for proximity to Disneyland and dining options.  The free breakfast buffet offers a nice variety of hot and cold dishes, is served in a nice, sunny room, and is carefully maintained by a crew of very attentive young ladies.  To avoid ticket lines at Disneyland, we tried to purchase Disneyland tickets at the hotel desk, but they don't sell one day tickets there.  The clerk did, however, suggest that we go to Discount Tickets and Tours, just a few steps away from the hotel.  Not only did we walk right in and quickly purchase our tickets, but they give a slight discount, which is something I've never seen
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay here at Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn.  I am glad we made your trip enjoyable.  Looking forward to your next visit.

Summary: We arrived for our weeklong stay three hours prior to check in due to better traffic and driving conditions than we planned for. The front desk got us pre registered and took all our bags for us so they weren't sitting in our car at the mercy of prying eyes in a busy tourist location. When we got our room keys we found a spacious (we had an ADA accessible) room that was recently renovated and very clean. The only downfall to the room was the fact that it was directly under the dining area. Which meant it was loud beginning at 6am with chairs and feet on the floor above. The pool amenities were up kept and a great feature for our family after long days in the park.   The closets are not really closets. They are cheap wardrobes, but they get the job done.  Also, the ADA room we
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to submit feedback regarding your recent stay at Best Western Anaheim Inn.  We regretfully apologize that your room was too far from the elevator.  In the future, do not be afraid to make your needs known to staff as we would love to do anything possible to accommodate disabilities in order to make your stay as enjoyable , convenient, and comfortable as possible.  Additionally, we will look into how to improve our information gathering regarding disabilities.  We look forward to servint you in the the future.

Summary: Location, location, location. I drank coffee on the patio of the breakfast room every morning watching people getting off of buses and walking from much farther away to the park entry which I could see from the hotel, knowing I would be at the park gates in 5 minutes. The room was lovely and I got a lot of credit from the family for booking it. After 12 hours at Disney, the short walk back and falling into the great bed was the perfect ending to a great day.
Manager Response: I am so pleased that you had an enjoyable experience recently at Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn.  I am here to serve you in order to make your travel experience an exceptional one.  As you stated, the breakfast room is a great place to relax in the morning and enjoy a nice cup a coffee.

Summary Heading: Great breakfast, good rooms and great price
Summary: This hotel is so close to Disneyland (over the crosswalk and to the right...maybe a 5 minute walk to Disney gates), has very decent rooms and a great breakfast!  The breakfast is more than a continental breakfast...scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, cereal, yogurt, etc!
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent feedback regarding your enjoyable stay at Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn.  I am so pleased that you enjoyed your experience with us and look forward to serving you in the future.  Our breakfast room is a recent addition to our hotel.  I am happy that you you enjoyed it.  We have something for everyone to enjoy to start your morning.

Summary: My family and I had a great experience. The staff were exceptional. They were courteous, helpful, friendly and professional.  Customer service was beyond amazing. Other then the rooms being a bit out dated, it was still a very comfortable stay and I would definitely recommend this property.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us feedback regarding your recent stay  at Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn.  It was my pleasure to serve you and assist in making your travel experience a positive one.  We are currently in the process of updating our rooms.  By this time next year all rooms will be complete.  I look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This is the fourth property that I've stayed at across the street from Disneyland and was my favorite. It's clean, the beds are comfortable and wasn't very noisy as we didn't hear any neighbors through the walls throughout our stay. The decor is a little outdated, but it wasn't a big issue for us. Besides the 5 minute walk to the park, parking is included as is breakfast which are both big perks. The breakfast room is on the third floor (some other reviews have noted it being loud underneath, so if you want to avoid that, ask not to be in rooms 201, 202 and 203). We were in room 206 on the second floor, so it was a quick walk up the stairs to get there and it wasn't noisy at all. They have a good amount of options including both hot and cold. The hot options varied on the days
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent feedback regarding your enjoyable stay at Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn.  Our Breakfast room is a new addition to our hotel.  We have a variety off options for everyone to enjoy.  We look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary: We stayed here 3 nights.  We had a week of events planned in the SF area.  It was an affordable UBER ride into the city and from there we took all public transportation with ease.  Some reviews on this hotel don't give this property justice.  It is a bit dated BUT the property is very well kept and completely clean!!  The food at the on site restaurant was very good and the bar staff was enjoyable!  Thanks Rosa!  The front desk was superb and helped us with a city tour.  Great free shuttle to the airport.  We highly recommend you book direct through the Best Western website and you should become a member of BW.  It is free to join and we for sure got the best price based on what were heard from other guests at the front desk.  (Sorry 3rd parties.)  McDonalds across street for
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent comment.  We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel with my adult kids and found it to be perfect. Great location right across the street from Disneyland. Breakfast was great with eggs sausage and assortied items. Great coffee. Bed were comfy. The only downside might be the parking. We did find a spot but once we found it we did not want to leave and lose it. Parking is a little tight but loved this hotel and would stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give feedback regarding your recent stay at Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn.  It was my pleasure to serve you and your family.   We look forward to your next visit.  We do offer free parking and it is guaranteed one car per reservation.

Summary: Excellent place to stay. Across the street from Disneyland and some good eateries. Breakfast selection was plentiful with a selection of eggs, ham / sausage, potatoes, waffles / pancakes pastries and more. Nice room with all the amenities. Would recommend. Just don't leave a wake up call with the front desk lady at night or try to use the in room phone. Set the alarm clock.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent feedback regarding your stay at Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn.  Please accept our apologies regarding your wake up calls.  While there were areas which met your expectations of customer service we would hope you come back and visit us again.

Summary: My family of twelve went to Disneyland.  This hotel offered all that we needed.  It was within walking distance to Disney and several restaurants.  We were able to get three rooms close together, the breakfast was really good, and we enjoyed the pool and hot tub.  We were all very pleased and would recommend staying here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent feedback regarding your enjoyable stay at Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn.  I am so please that you and your family enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Whenever I plan a trip to Disneyland I book my rooms at the Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn.  Not only is it in a perfect location (right across the street), but the staff and the breakfast are wonderful.  Elizabeth at the front desk is the best!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us feedback regarding your recent stay at Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn.  It is my pleasure to serve you and assist in making your travel experience a positive one.  We look forward to seeing you in the future!  I will be sure to relay the message to Elizabeth.  She is an asset to the Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn Family.

Summary: When checking into hotel, TELL reception staff to not put you in 201!!!!!  This room is directly underneath the breakfast buffet lounge.  You'll be woken up promptly at 6am with noises from chairs being dragged across floor.  People running or walking very heavily across the room.  These noises go for 4hrs till 10am.  So if you want to something besides an alarm clock to get you out of bed, request this room; otherwise avoid it like THE PLAGUE!!!!!  I would've given an overall rating for this hotel/motel 4-stars for the value and proximity to Disneyland.  BUT the fact I wasn't informed/warned about the 4-HRS of noise I would be subjected to brought it down to 2-star/slightly below average overall rating.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your experience so we may better serve you and others in the future.  While it is true about that location, I apologize that your room was under the breakfast room.  Your business is very important to us and we value your feedback.  By letting us know we will be sure to let guest know about the location and the noises above their room.  Often times guest are aware and will take that room because it is available for check-in before 3pm.

Summary: This hotel is directly across the street from Disneyland. It is under renovation so be aware of limited rooms available. The parking lot is designed to allow the cars for each room not the additional construction trash/equipment. If you need a wheel chair during your stay at Disneyland I would recommend having it delivered to the hotel. You will add to the comfort of the person needing the wheelchair. Disneyland wheelchairs do not go to downtown Disney or off property.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent feedback regarding your stay here at the Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn.  As you stated, we are in the process of renovation and it will be completed this time next year.  With that in mind, parking is a little tight during this time but is guaranteed.  Thank you for taking the time to let us know your concerns.   Hopeful that you will stay with us once the renovation is complete.

Summary Heading: The place to stay if visiting Disney Land
Summary: We booked into this motel for five days with our two granddaughters for our three day visit to Disney. The motel is situated across the road from the Disney Park with an easy ten minute  walk to the main entrances. The motel has a good swimming pool, complete with beach sized towels for personal use. If required, a very clean laundry (coin operated) is available. A generous hot or cold breakfasts are included its rates. The ever popular Denny's restaurant and other restaurants are all in close proximity.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent feedback regarding your enjoyable stay at the Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn.  We look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary Heading: Good breakfast, prompt service, okay rooms, value for money
Summary: Just across the street from the Disneyland gate.  1. the complimentary breakfast spread is really good. From bagels, to pastries fruits and yogurt and waffles they had it all. You can sit on the balcony in case it gets too hot inside.  2. The rooms were big but a bit shady for my liking.  3. The bathrooms were clean but small and has a bit of a water logging issue.  4. however the stuff was very prompt and resolved the problems.  Good value for money hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is a great value for the money and location among other things. It is located about 100 mts from   Disney's entrance. The breakfast included is great and perfect for starting your day before entering Disney. The staff is very helpful and you can use the pc to print your boarding pass or plane ticket etc. With no extra charge. You can notice that the hotel has been refurnished.  The cleanliness is great.  I would recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: our stay with Best Western Plus
Summary: Well, my family and I were very excited to make our way to USA< a trip of a lifetime, hence trying to find a accommodation for my family of 6 was at first daunting.  I always like to plan in advance and so off I went to find the best accommodation. The reason why I chose this place was because it was just across the road from Disneyland. Way too easy and so convenient. We were very happy about the service received and we loved it. The unit was clean and tidy! The only thing that we felt it was strange was trying to figure out how to work the shower took awhile to get used to, which was abit annoying and time consuming but other than that we are looking forward to staying there again because who wants to travel far just to get to one of the most amazing places to see.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I stayed here for five nights while visiting Disneyland, Disneyland California Adventure, and Universal Studios. Loved it! Great customer service, clean rooms, free hot breakfast, and super close to the Disneyland entrance... what's not to love?   The front desk personnel was able to accommodate an early check-in.  Housekeeping always did a good job.  Our housekeeper would arrange the kids' stuffed animals so nicely on the beds; that really amused the kids. When our toilet clogged, maintenance came within five minutes after we called. Every worker always greeted my family and me with a smile and "good morning" or "hello." I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: 5 minute walk to Disneyland. Hotel is situated that if your room is on the top floor you can see the fireworks from Disneyland without leaving the hotel grounds. Short trek to Denny's Restaurant or McDonald's,  which we eat at before going to Disneyland. Much cheaper than eating in the parks. You can take a shuttle from LAX to  the front door of this hotel-skip the rental car if you are only going to the parks. Great breakfast, great pool.  There is also a 2 room suite available.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Family of 6 had 2 adjoining rooms in September and can't complain the rooms where nice and clean, beds were comfortable and the location for Disneyland and California Adventure Park was great. Service was good, pool was clean and gym was only small but handy still. Would definitely stay here again if we were looking for something in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pros: Easy walk back from the Disney Parks to rest up. Simple, but has everything you need. Good variety at breakfast to get the day started. Well lit at night.   Con: Parking is tight! Walls are very thin, could hear people next door having conversations late at night.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Don't stay at this hotel you will be very disappointed with the rooms and the staff seems to like lying to the guests.  The bathrooms had bugs in them. Only positive was the breakfast and the breakfast staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ideal location, Bonus Facilities, Excellent Staff!
Summary: Ideal if visiting Disneyland (5 minute walk), bonus gym, outside pool and jacuzzi. Great choice at breakfast and parking is available. Local shops and restaurants also with great choice. The staff go the extra mile, phoning the room daily to see if everything is ok and if you need anything, I've never witnessed this anywhere else. Would definitely stay here again. If you were asking me to pick any gripe, the beds could be comfier, but thats only if you were asking.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful customer service with close proximity to Disneyland
Summary: Went to Disneyland with a friend and her daughter. We had a wonderful time, excellent breakfast every morning and most importantly such a short walk across the street to Disneyland. Rooms we're clean and well kept. I appreciate the follow up call after our stay to make sure our room change/upgrade worked for us - it really did! Thank you Best Western, we will be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 7 nights for the Disneyland Half Marathon in the 2 room King suite.  The room was newly updated with brand new bedding (which was extremely comfortable). A very spacious room, clean and great value. The location was also perfect, especially after long days at Disney, it was great to be able to walk across the road to the hotel.  Check-in was a very smooth and quick and the staff were very friendly and helpful.  The pool and spa area were great (especially after running the half marathon), the area is a little smaller then some hotels but does the job.  Breakfast was also great, plenty of hot and cold options which were constantly been topped up by the staff.  The only con I have is that although it is a 2 room suite there isn't a door separating the 2 rooms,
Manager Response: none

Summary: 10 min walk from downtown Disney. Free car parking. Nice outdoor pool area. Garage next door that sells beers and ciders, ideal for relaxing with near the pool.  Simple breakfast provided. Rooms clean and tidy. Staff very friendly and helpful. We travelled from Vegas that day and the trafic wasnt as bad as we had allowed for. We where allowed to check in 2 hours early.  As everyone was at Disney the hotel was really quiet during the day  Would stay again if in the area
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for three nights whilst visiting Disneyland and were very happy with our choice. It is opposite the parks so super easy to walk to. The longest park of the walk is waiting for the pedestrian lights to go green!!  Parking was free which was rare in the area so a great bonus. The breakfast was fine, it had a good selection but we preferred the ihop next door! The room was large and clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and would happily return.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while at Disney!
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, the distance to Disneyland was perfect! An easy walk, especially after a long day. The breakfast was very nice, the pool is clean and was nice to cool off in after a long day. The employees were all very kind and welcoming. We would definitely stay here again. The only downside was the beds, not very comfortable at all.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My friend suggestion we stay here and I'm so glad she did.  We were only doing a short disneyland stay and for a little bit more money, than one night on property, we stayed here TWO nights.  It made getting into the park so much easier.  We drove down on Friday night, stayed the night, got up and went to Disneyland on Saturday.  We left the park during nap time, got our hands stamped, and went to the Denny's near the hotel.  There was also an IHOP and other places super close by.  We ate at IHOP too (I actually think that was right by the hotel).  We ate lunch off property and then relaxed at our hotel for a bit before going back out later with our toddler.  Everyone at the hotel was super nice.  If we had stayed on property at Disney it would have ended up costing us more
Manager Response: none

Summary: average rooms that are clean and beds are comfortable. Price is a bit higher than nicer hotel down the street but this hotel is directly across the street from Disney parks. Breakfast was good with large selection of items with hot items also. Parking with permit good until 6 pm on day of checkout but not good for large work vehicles. Had a maintenance employee enter our room without permission to let someone in by mistake. Protect your belongings while staying here. Lots of resturants close by.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Tis is a great hotel, close to Disneyland and next door to restaurants. We had a lovely room and very nice people are there to help us enjoy the stay.  Nice rooms, quiet, friendly.  Pool and hot tub. Have stayed there numerous times and always the best quality.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have thoroughly enjoyed staying at The Best Western Anaheim Hotel for many years.  It's conveniently located a block away from Disneyland, has great staff members, nice accommodations, and good value for the price.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms are a but shabby but the location is a plus. It's a stone throw away from Disneyland. Breakfast is for free. If you're traveling for long and needed to do your laundry it's really cheap here. The best part of the hotel is the location as there are many restaurants around the area.if you're looking for a luxury hotel do not book here. If you want to be practical and just have a comfortable sleep ask for s room upstairs so you won't hear the. Owning and going of the cars. All in all it was still a good experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just a short walk across the road to Downtown Disney, Disney's California Adventure and Disneyland. The location is close to a number of restaurants, the rooms are clean and spacious, and the breakfasts are ample and varied,
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is literally across the road from the entrance to Disneyland and in short walking distance to a good range of restaurants and other eating places. The room was simple, but clean and comfortable. On the down side, our room was directly below the dining room so as soon as 6.30 am came and breakfast began the scraping of chairs proved a very successful alarm. Regardless, we were there to do the Disney parks so it was fit for purpose.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were at this hotel for the 2016 Disneyland Half Marathon Weekend and couldn't have been much happier with our stay. All the staff we encountered were friendly. They had snack bags out in the lobby at 5am each day for the race participants and kept the breakfast area open late on half marathon day so that we could have food when we got back after the race. The location is almost perfect, as the entrance to Disneyland is half a block away and across the street. The free breakfast has plenty of hot and cold choices. And free parking! We will definitely return to this hotel on our next trip. The price and the location can't be beat.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We only stayed 4 nights but really liked the hotel! Reception staff were amazingly helpful and friendly, can't thank them enough! The pool was lovely and the hot tub was bliss after a long day! The breakfast food was the usual spread but tasty, and the breakfast room had an outdoor balcony overlooking the street which was nice! The hotel was clean, well maintained and in a great location for Disney! Would recommend!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed August/September 2016 - 4 Adults for 5 nights. A perfect location for Disneyland access. A short 5-7min walk to the security checkpoint of the parks. Located on the side of the park which has less popular access and as such the wait at security is not as long as the Downtown Disney side. The hotel has the ability to sell Disneyland tickets. Unfortunately they did not sell the 5 day park hopper I was after; but they did recommend us to walk next door to the Discount Tickets & Tours shop which sold the 5 day ticket at a discount. The hotel has free car parking and a self service laundry which is always handy and welcomed. The complimentary breakfast was a perfect start for a day at the parks. Options of hot breakfast items, cereals, yogurts, bagels, muffins, toast, pastries
Manager Response: none

Summary: Close to Disneyland Resort.  Always clean and the staff is excellent.  We stay here at least 2 times a year reserving 2-5 rooms each time.  Breakfast is perfect!  Price is right.  You cannot beat this motel.  Good for all ages.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was reasonably priced and within walking distance of Disneyland.  The faucet in my bath tub was leaking - but to be fair, I did not report it until check-out. The bedding (sheets and blanket) were coarse and uncomfortable, but the beds themselves were actually pretty comfortable. The breakfast was pretty impressive, with waffles or pancakes, ham or sausage, eggs, and potatoes (and not greasy ones!) The hotel even extended the breakfast until 11 a.m. on the morning of the half marathon, which was great.  The hotel also provided to-go bags (water, granola bar, and apple) to take with us to the race.  The parking was included in the rate, although there was a small ($5) resort fee.  If you want a good breakfast, but don't want to spend a lot of $ and don't need a lot of
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Can't get closer to the magic
Summary: Had a 2 night stay here to visit Disneyland, literally a 5 minute walk to the gates. The rooms are basic but for a base there perfectly fine, the buffet breakfast included was good. If you have a room on the 3rd floor you get a perfect view of the fireworks from the balcony if you don't want to stay late in the park. So glad we stayed here as it is so close and after a long day in the parks it's nice to be in your room before most people are in the car park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our second time returning to Disneyland within the last two years.  Our first time staying at this hotel.  The room was very spacious for a family of four with two teenagers.  The bedding was very nice and the firm mattress offered a good night rest after a day of walking.  Excellent breakfast buffet; far better than the normal continental breakfast offered by other hotels.  Free parking for hotel guest.  Front of the gate access to Disneyland.  Definitely will return to this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were visiting Disneyland for five days and the fact that the hotel was just across the street was a big deal.  The rooms were very quiet. You never heard any shower noise or voices.  The breakfast was large and covered many food groups.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel never disappoints.  Friendly staff, clean hotel, inside and out.  The beds are top notch and always provide a comfortable night's rest.  The breakfast always seems to have new things added; love the new oatmeal/yoghurt "bar"!  This has been my 'go to' Anaheim hotel for the past few years, and I never consider any other hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location can't really be beat.  This location is not quite as nice as the Park Vue Inn, but since they are both so close who can ask for a better location.  The room was on the lower floor as requested at time of reservation, the breakfast was hot/filling.  I just did not like that they wouldn't allow food to be taken to the room
Manager Response: none

Summary: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Disneyland. It was a perfect location,just a little less than a block to the pedestrian crosswalk into the parks.  Very clean and well run. Desk staff was very helpful and always greeted us with a smile. Nice breakfast, too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location is prime they need to add dinning room for guest who are there to spend more time at Disney. bath tub are out dated might as well make them to shower only/  Add shuttle to go to Disney down town would be supper ideal.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our room was not very clean and we found the lady at reception was rather unwelcoming. They charge a so called "resort fee" of $5 per night which is clearly just an unfair way of offering a good rate on price comparators and then slapping on an extra charge.  The person at reception just knows this is going to poison the relation with the new customer, hence the withdrawn attitude. It would be so much better to be honest and square by including this upfront.   Otherwise, it couldn't be closer to the park entrance and the complimentary breakfast is good.   Because of the unclean room, we would not choose to stay here on another visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The best and the worst hotel in Anaheim
Summary: This is a very difficult hotel to review. I think it is the best hotel in Anaheim and perhaps also the worst. Let's start with why I think it is the worst: The hotel feels like it is even build before Disneyland opened back in 1955. Americans are not used to very old building like we are in, for instance Amsterdam, The Netherlands, where people still live in building from the early 17th century. But this hotel in Anaheim is close to being that old.   The bathroom door hardly fits and barely closes, the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything. The floors are made out of cardboard and you can feel when a nearby guests steps out of his bed. When you close the door, the air pressure almost pushes out the windows. I doubt that this hotel will survive any serious earthquake.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our first stay at this location.  I believe the value was great for the location to Disneyland.  We stayed on the first floor as we were arriving late and tired.  Our room was quiet and comfortable.  AC worked well and helped block out any outside noise.  I am glad they have a window that opens in the bathroom to allow ventilation from the shower.  The beds were comfortable, plenty of towels and nice to have fridge and microwave.  Only complaint about the room is it needs updating (but hear they are working on that) and cleaning the carpets should happen more often.  I always wear slippers at hotel stays but it was much needed in our room.    Breakfast was good, many choices.  Filled us up before going to Disneyland each day.  I didn't mind that you could not take food
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked a suite through Verizon rewards and there was an issue with the room but Vivian and Laura at the front desk were very helpful and very patient as I made calls to clear up the confusion with Verizon. They took care of the issue ASAP and were so helpful and apologetic for the issue even though it was not their fault. Both were kind polite and patient and smiled the hole time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our 3rd stay here in 5 years ,with a family of 5 , for some much needed relaxation. Price and proximity to Disneyland makes this Best Western a no brainer selection .... Only drawback is rooms need some updating, but were clean and comfy regardless.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Made a reservation last minute and thought that would be a problem. But the staff took great care of me and my family. The hotel was perfect because it was in walking distance. I was happy with how helpful all the staff was. They were able to answer all questions and were very friendly while assisting me. I would defiantly recommend this hotel and will defiantly be staying there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location. A short walk across the street from Disneyland. Check in was fast and easy. Very friendly and helpful staff. There's a computer with printer in the lobby so you can check in and print your boarding passes for your flight home. Rooms were clean and efficient. There's a fridge, coffee maker and microwave in the room. Free breakfast which was good. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location across the street from Disneyland
Summary: The best part about this hotel is that it's across the street from Disneyland. It's convenient because you can just walk over and take a break after a long day at the park. The rooms don't face Disneyland though so you probably cant get a good view of the fireworks from your room. Other than that it's a fairly average Best Western with free breakfast in the morning. Our room seemed kind of small for being two beds. Especially the bathroom was tiny.We were just two adults and one teen and we did fine for the most part but I could see a family with kids struggling in here. Our room was very clean though and the beds even seemed new. I took off a star for the price ($200/night). I've stayed in Best Westerns that were much nicer and cheaper but I'm sure it's because this one is so
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was clean with all amenities.  Furnishings were a bit dated. Very much a family style Inn.  Breakfast was ok but not up to standards of other hotels we have been too.  Was very hot and A/C was adequate but not as cool as I would have liked.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved this hotel. Really close to Disneyland and great breakfast. The pool is really small but if you plan to spend your whole time at Disney, it is not that important. Our kids still had fun swimming in it in the evenings.
Manager Response: I'm happy that your kids had fun swimming after a long day at the Park.  Hope to see you on your next trip.

Summary: This is an old style hotel, which does require to be updated. However, talking to staff members, they are in the process of updating their rooms. This was good news, as we have stayed here every year that we have visited Disneyland.  On inspection of the bathroom, we noticed that there was some damage to the bath. They asked if we wanted to change rooms to the upgraded rooms, which we declined as the bath was fixed the next day.  There is a moderatly sized breakfast buffet, that would set you up for the day, and a fitness room if walking around Disneyland is not for your liking.  One issue is the tight parking situation, which made parking the car difficult when the most of the spaces were taken.  The big plus is how close it is to the Disneyland Resort, which is the main
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for your loyalty.  We look forward to seeing you on your next trip to the Disneyland Resort.

Summary: we stayed for 4 nights on this visit, and if you are looking for the perfect location for Disneyland...this is it!  A 4 minute walk from the entrance to the park, which (when kids get tired) is a godsend.  we arrived at 12:00pm expecting to have to leave our bags in storage until check in time...but our room was ready for us!  Another bonus with this location is that we were able to leave at the hottest time of the day, have a swim, then get back to the park quickly.  Pool was fairly small, but clean.  Could have done with it being a little colder actually as it was so hot outside!.  Room was adequate, since you won't be spending a lot of time in it anyway.    we did have an issue with the hand sink not draining (plug got stuck).  But it was fixed by the time we got back to the
Manager Response: You are one of the lucky ones able to get in your room early.  I'm glad we were able to do that for you.

Summary: It is just a 2 to 3 minutes walk to the entrance gate of Disneyland. It is nice to go back to the hotel room and have a rest have lunch or dinner and back again to the park. Food at the park is expensive. Room is clean and housekeeping is done every day. Breakfast is superb. . . Good breakfast! Will be back again for sure!
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed your stay, see you next time.

Summary: You can't beat the location from Disneyland (across the street from the west entrance); easy walking distance. I was attending a conference at the Disneyland Hotel, on the east side, and even that was a tolerable walking distance. The new complimentary breakfast area is very pleasant with good (hot) food selections, a cut above the typical continental breakfast. The room itself was clean and basic with the usual amenities. It was nice to have the refrigerator and microwave, which helps with the food expenses.
Manager Response: I'm so happy to hear you enjoyed our breakfast.

Summary: Enjoyable stay highly recommended. Was a relief to arrive after a very long flight to relax in the spa pool. Very conveniently placed just across the road from Disneyland to have a break and then return for the night parade and fire works. Breakfast menu gave variety, handy laundry facilities for guests to use, staff were very friendly and helpful. Car parking was available free of charge.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us!

Summary Heading: AVOID! THEY MAKE UP REASONS TO KEEP YOUR DEPOSIT
Summary: DO NOT STAY HERE. THEY MAKE UP REASONS TO KEEP YOUR $100 DEPOSIT!!! I booked through Getaway today. The hotel took it upon themselves to make up some dumb excuse as to why I couldn't get my $100 deposit back. I was told at checkout that it would be reimbursed. I called them almost a month later because I still didn't see the reimbursement. They found my reservation super fast and all information HAD TO BE in front of them but the incompetent front desk employee told me they had to "find the reason why my deposit was never returned". More like, they had to find a BOGUS EXCUSE for why it wasn't returned. I got a call an hour later and they said the deposit was used to fix a lock on the bathroom door. The bathroom door was left open my entire stay there. I never once even touched
Manager Response: The Best Western Anaheim Inn does not collect a deposit from our guests at check in so that leads me to believe that you stayed at another Best Western here in Anaheim.  If you truly believe that it was the Anaheim Inn, please give me a call at 714-774-1050 so I can assist you in locating the property you stayed at.

Summary: Awesome staff and convenient location. Just a walking distance away from Disneyland. The services were fast and the breakfast were warm and has good options. We will definitely stay at this location again!
Manager Response: We try to keep your time checking and out short so you can spend more time doing what you came here to do, enjoying the Disneyland Resort.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: If you're looking for a convenient location while visiting Disneyland and DCA, this property is a good choice. Rates are reasonable for the area. Parking is included, it's and easy walk to the parks, and the breakfast is better than many others.  The pool is big enough for small children to slash around. Housekeeping does a very good job and the front desk staff is friendly and beautiful.
Manager Response: I can't with to tell my front desk staff that you thought they were friendly and beautiful!  You made their day, thank you!

Summary: Location was perfect for Disneyland, right near the entrance. Rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable. Walls are a little thin and we were woken at night by a crying child (and we are heavy sleepers) but otherwise it was pretty quiet. The free internet and included breakfast were nice bonuses and helped us pick this hotel over the others.
Manager Response: You're right, it's all about location.  Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: Walking distance to Disneyland.  Free parking and breakfast!  Great value for the perks.  had a microwave, small coffee machine with coffee and small fridge in the room. Room was kind of small with the two double beds.  Staff was friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: I was moving around all week staying at different hotels every night, so a nice breakfast is very important to me. This hotel has one of the better breakfast buffets of any hotel I have stayed. They have a nice variety of selection. The bed in the room was comfortable & I got a good night of sleep.
Manager Response: We pride ourselves on our breakfast, I'm so happy you enjoyed it.

Summary: very helpfull staff. could watch the night time fireworks from our room balcony. walking across the road to disneyland was a big plus. free breakfast and right next door to denny's for a meal. all round very convenient
Manager Response: Disney's fireworks have always been a favorite of everyone.  I'm glad you were able to enjoy them from this side of Harbor!

Summary: Overall our stay was fine and the convenience of staying across the street from Disneyland was great.  The hotel itself and the rooms are very outdated, but clean.  Parking was not good, but once we found a spot we never moved the car as long as we were there.
Manager Response: I have to agree with you, the rooms do need to be updated and that is what we are planning to due in 2017.  I hope you'll be back to see us.

Summary: My family vacationed here for the first time and were very happy with the property!  While the property is older, it was clean and very comfortable.  The staff was very friendly and super helpful.  The breakfast was very nice and being able to walk to the park was a HUGE plus.  We were able to come back to our room in the afternoons for breaks and to freshen up.  We were even able to view some of the firework show from our balcony at night.  Great choice!
Manager Response: Thank you for trying the Anaheim Inn!  We hope to see you again.

Summary: We stayed here at end of May. This place is well managed, rooms are clean and staff very helpful. We booked a dbl bed room. This was a mistake - needed a queen  or king bed. this was the only fault. Five minute walk to Disneyland and Adventure park. A number of restaurants close by.
Manager Response: I wish we had rooms with queen beds but our rooms will only accommodate 2 double beds or 1 king bed.  I'm sorry that didn't work for you.

Summary: Clean, comfortable and close to the Park for that much needed mid afternoon siesta. Ya gotta get up early to beet the crowds and the firework show is amazing, so a break in the middle of the day was great.
Manager Response: It's all about being able to rest so that you can close the Parks!  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: First time at this property.  The property itself is older as evidenced by the drywall repair and paint around the window in the bathroom and around the a/c unit (also in the sink area along the back wall, which was unusual) but it was clean and comfortable.  All the staff we came across were friendly and efficient and the breakfast was a pleasant surprise!  Lots of options, clean breakfast room, and you have the option to sit outside on the patio overlooking Disney California Adventure and watch the world go by.  We will be back. OH and the free wifi works, AND they don't charge for parking, which is pretty unusual in this immediate area.
Manager Response: You are correct, the property is older but we will be starting a remodel in our guest rooms the end of this year into next.  I do hope you'll be back to see it.

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel right across the street from Disneyland
Summary: We did Disneyland for 4 days and absolutely loved staying at this hotel. We had a family suite, which has a living room, two bedrooms and a generously sized bathroom - all for a very reasonable rate. The room was clean, updated and the beds were comfortable.  Parking for 1 car is free and every day you can do a 5 minute walk to be at the front gates of Disney. You were basically as close to the entrance gates as if you stayed at the Disneyland hotel and at a fraction of the cost.  We have definitely found our place to stay for any visit to Disneyland in the future.
Manager Response: It sounds like you stayed in our Family Suite next to the office.  It's a one of a kind, so glad you liked it.

Summary Heading: Have a nice vacation at Best Western Plus
Summary: very nice hotel to stay; is close to Disneyland (in walking distance);  rooms are nice size, clean and employee are friendly and professional. The breakfast was delicious and lots of food to choose from.  Have free Wi-Fi.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us, I'm happy you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: We had a great experience at this hotel. It was close to Disneyland (right across the street), great full breakfast, VERY nice hotel staff, clean room. You might want to avoid the 3rd floor on same side as dining room as it can get noisy with families going to breakfast.
Manager Response: It's hard to keep hungry families quite in the mornings, I'm so sorry if they bothered you.  Next time you visit please let us know you want to be away from the breakfast area ans we'll happy yo accommodate you.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay fro Disneyland
Summary: Good place to stay when visiting Disneyland as it is literately across the road to the Disney entrance. Rooms are a bit dated in the decor but they were clean which is what really matters. Breakfast is average as it is a Motel so don't expect too much more than toast and cereal, there are scrambled eggs and a hot selection but not didn't look especially appealing and as there is an IHOP only 2 minutes away its not a problem. To sum up good value for its location relative to Disneyland.
Manager Response: We try to offer a variety of items at our breakfast, I'm sorry if it didn't work for you, but as you said there is an IHOP and a Denny's next door.  I hope you'll be back to see us.

Summary: The hotel location  to the parks was AMAZING!! The cleanliness was great!! The free breakfast was a great/cheap way to start the day before heading to the parks. The size of the room was a little snug because of the small table and chairs they put in there but I understand they were trying to give an alternative seating option. I highly recommend this place to stay if you plan on going to Disneyland.  Only thing I had issues with was the wifi but we were hardly in the room.
Manager Response: I have to agree, the location can't be beat.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: Free Parking is a plus but only good until 6:00pm day of check out so should consider this if staying late on check out date. Breakfast was top notch, lots of offerings including hot food. Lots of seating including an outside area. They have a check in attendant outside  the restaurant that makes sure registered guests enter. Our room was 318, room that had 2 bedrooms and 3 beds......it was great for our family of 6....but it was a very narrow 2nd room which seemed a bit awkward but wasn't an issue. For a longer term stay.....1 bathroom would be rough to get ready with 6 people.
Manager Response: We'd love to let you park longer but we have to made the space available for the guests arriving that day.  We also have suites with a kind and two double beds, you may want to try that one next time.

Summary: It was good, the price was right and it was nice to have some breakfast in the morning. The rooms were clean and all worked well. It was nice to be able to walk to the Disneyland park.  I will stay there again for sure. Thank you
Manager Response: I look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Stay here for the location, and nothing else
Summary: We stayed here because of the fantastic location to the Disney area. It is the only reason you stay here. The rooms are very standard three star ( that is being generous ) and the buffet breakfast is acceptable. Once you know this, you can be prepared. Would I stay here again. Yes. Just across the road from the entrance. Can't beat that.
Manager Response: I agree, the location is hard to beat.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Location can't be beat, but not great value for the price...
Summary: Stayed for 2 nights to go to Disneyland, and the location was awesome and can't be faulted. The hotel is clean, but looking very tired. It looks like maybe parts of it have been refurbed, while others are still waiting.   Bathroom was very small, the aircon was noisy but the beds were comfy. Staff were helpful when we needed to talk to them too, I can't fault that either. Parking is a problem if you have more than one car per room, so just beware.  Overall, I think I'd probably choose to stay a little further away than across the street from the gates and get a more comfortable room for the same price, than stay here again. You can get better value elsewhere I think.
Manager Response: You are correct, we recently added the breakfast room and remodeled the front during that process.  We are starting on the rest of the property this fall and hope to finish up by the fall of 2017.  I hope that you will reconsider staying with us again.

Summary: We choose BW because of its Continental Breakfast option. I grabbed a plate of food, and was ready to bring it back to the room to enjoy it with my family. I was told I cannot bring the food outside the dinning area. I explained they are still sleeping. The server insisted. I had to toss the food in the trash. This rule is ridiculous and never had I dealt with such policy. We frequent the BW chain, prefers them over Marriott at some locations, but this is the WORST. We've always been able to enjoy breakfast in our room if we choose, but this place is an exception and not in a good way.  This review would not matter to you if you just need a place to sleep and play all day at Disneyland. A family with kids would be affected by this policy and should stay elsewhere.  My first stay
Manager Response: Because of the size of the breakfast room and the serving time of three and a half hours we haven't found our dine in policy to be a problem.  We try to mention it at check in as well as posting it in the breakfast room.  I'm sorry it didn't work for you and your family.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, very close to Disneyland
Summary: This was a great hotel.  We stayed here in May and spent 3 days at Disneyland.  This hotel is very close to the walkway to get into Disneyland.  The room was very clean.  We never used the maid service as we don't like people in our room when we are not there, however, we were able to get all the towels and linens we needed sent up to our room in the evening. The breakfast was amazing and very extensive. Will definetly be staying here on our next trip.
Manager Response: It's nice to hear you thought we were great even without maid service.  I'm glad you were able to get everything thing you needed in the evening.  See you on your next trip.

Summary: The location is a short walk to Disneyland main entrance, 10 minutes at the very most. The room was clean and comfortable and had a fridge. Wifi worked great even for streaming Netflix. Free full breakfast with the largest dining area I've seen at a Best Western. The pool was clean and warm. I will always check this hotel on future visits.
Manager Response: I have to admit we do have a large breakfast area, makes for a great start to the day.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay across from Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is 10+! Just across from Disneyland. Older property that has been renovated and is immaculate. Huge breakfast room on the 3rd floor with hotel breakfast items and friendly, professional staff. The rooms are smoke-free, spotless and comfortable. Hotel right next to Denny's and walking distance to McD's, Panera Bakery, etc. Will always stay here when visiting Disneyland!
Manager Response: I look forward to your next visit.

Summary: 5 stars, very comfortable beds, I did not want get up. we stayed there because we were going to Disneyland for the day and did not want to make the long drive home that night. So we came in a day early and used the pool witch was very nice to relax after two hours of traffic. In the morning we were treated with a nice Continental breakfast. then spent the whole day at Disneyland,  and all we had to do was cross he street to get to are hotel. We got a great night sleep, had breakfast and got on the road and headed home. thanks to the great staff for a nice stay
Manager Response: So happy you enjoyed your stay.  Hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: If you plan visiting Disneyland, you choose the right one
Summary: Read the other review and make a decision choosing this hotel which is slightly more expensive. It is really close to the park and you just cross the road. I've been to other Disneyland- Florida, Japan and HK. After a long day enjoying everything inside, you feel extremely tired and just want to get home asap. All the other place need to take transport either back to your hotel or resorts at the park. I remember in Florida, you may take up to 30minutes back to hotel (if you are lucky getting on their first bus after firework and everyone rushing back at the same time.) This hotel also provides breakfast which you can stuffed yourselves with more than enough breakfast and go to park for a 4-5 hour fun before having lunch break.  Like other Best Western, it also has guest laundry
Manager Response: I have to agree with you, our location is hard to beat.  Thanks for choosing the Anaheim Inn.

Summary: This is the best location. Disneyland is just across the road and it's close to loads of dining options including an easy stroll to Garden Walk.The hotel is clean, well maintained and has everything you need: fridge, microwave, iron, hairdryer etc. The complimentary breakfast is quite generous. There is a laundry on the 2nd floor, the pool area looked nice ( we didn't use it). We could see the Disney fireworks from the balcony off our room. There was also free parking for guests which was great. The bus stop for the Citadel shuttle was seconds from the hotel. Great value and really super friendly and helpful staff. Will highly recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recommendation.

Summary Heading: Great room with awesome breakfast for FREE!
Summary: We recently visited the Disneyland resort and opted to stay at the Best Western Anahiem inn. I read the reviews before deciding to book which were mixed, but went ahead thinking it's just across the street from the park and we won't be in the room very often or for a long period of time.  They have a gaurantee check in at 3 and we made it just after 3 to the hotel. As promised our room was ready! Very clean, although there was a weird smell at first, and being in the maintenence industry quickly realized it was the cleaning solutions used to clean the rooms lol. The beds were firm but comfortable, the air conditioner worked great and I loved not having to bring a iron or hair dryer. We went to breakfast the next morning and were pleasantly surprised at scambled eggs, sausage
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the great review!

Summary: The hotel is located directly across the street from the entrance to Disneyland.  The rooms are clean and have a small refrigerator with in-room air conditioning. The staff is extremely friendly and go out of their way to assist.  A complimentary breakfast is served in the morning and is quite good.  There are cereals, fruit, breads, eggs, ham or sausage, waffles or pancakes and juices and milk.   Of course, they also have coffee and tea. I loved being able to walk to Disneyland and not pay an enormous amount for lodging.  I highly recommend this hotel.  My only suggestion is that they did not have in-room safes and I prefer that option.
Manager Response: I'm sorry that we didn't have in room safes for you but hope my staff let you know that they are available at the desk.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: This is a very nice, clean hotel in an excellent location.  It's probably closer to the Disneyland entrance than the official Disneyland Resort is, which is very convenient for an afternoon nap or a change of clothes after "splash mountain" turns into "soak every article of clothing mountain".  A good, hot breakfast that has ample seating is included.  The staff top to bottom was very friendly.  For a family on a budget you can't get better than the two Best Westerns that are right at the entrance to the park. (I've posted a similar sounding review to the Best Western Plus Park Place Inn and Mini Suites.  If you can get it, that one is slightly closer and usually cheaper with bigger and nicer rooms but a slightly worse breakfast room.  I go for Park Place Inn first when I stay
Manager Response: I'll take runner up!

Summary: We loved our stay at Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn.  The staff were extremely friendly and our room was great.  We were on the top level and could see the Disney fireworks from the balcony. The room itself was clean and spacious. We had a room with two double beds even though it was just the two of us (two beds were cheaper than one!). Breakfast was great and began at 6.30am for those of us who wanted to be at the parks for the early magic hours. There was a great variety and very fresh. Onsite car parking was good as well and we didn't have any issues getting a park. We also used the laundry and this was inexpensive and clean. We didn't use the pool however it looked clean and well maintained. We loved the proximity to Disney - right across the street with Denny's right next
Manager Response: I so glad you were able to take advantage of our laundry room.  It gets a lot of use!

Summary: The room was great, (room 307), you can see the Disneyland Fireworks from the room.  Good breakfast, plenty of options.  Nice staff.  Very short walk to Disney entrance.  Definitely would stay here again!
Manager Response: Sometimes it nice to see the fireworks from a distance and our third floor is great for that.  Glad you able to enjoy them without being in the Park.

Summary: Great quality, white bedding and Linen. Comfy beds and pillows. Very clean. Roomy. Staff was kind and helpful. The front desk booked a shuttle for my arrival. Held my luggage for the day since I was on a tour. Right across from Disneyland. Highly, highly recomend. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: We look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Best Western Plus Anaheim, across from Disneyland
Summary: Very helpful staff,  rooms were very clean, easy access to our destination, pool was clean and great for swimming, hot tub was wonderful and towels were provided. Only problem was we needed to sleep 5 and room allowed for 4.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This location is the best, just a block away from the entrance to Disneyland. The staff I would rate as extremely high as they are very helpful with any of your needs. I have stayed here before and would recommend this location to anyone who asks where the best place to stay is. The breakfast gets you started with your day, whether you just want a coffee and bagel to a full breakfast. This location is the Best of the Best.
Manager Response: none

Summary: As I stated before the staff was unhelpful rude and obnoxious and did not honor type of reservation made for parking. Basically all they had to do is allow us to park and extra hour or two we would have paid anything not to get our weekend ruined.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Okay, I've stayed here before a few years ago so I thought it was a no-brainer when going back to Disneyland.  First the good:  close to the park, great breakfast (that is also free), free parking (but with a caveat), and clean hot tub and pool.  Now why I may consider another hotel on Harbor Blvd next time:  the beds, double size only.  I always think that hotel beds are smaller in size in general so if it's a double, it seems like a twin.  The room:  I unfortunately got room 203 which if you do a search has another review that mentions it.  Its on the second floor and DIRECTLY below the breakfast room on the third floor (great planning whoever thought that up).  This room is also the ADA compliant room which I find "funny" that you already  may have challenges in life, now you
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Location - Routine Service - Poor Breakfast - Complete Lack of Charm
Summary: Last April my wife and I spent four nights at this hotel. We booked this lodging through the Disney Vacation packages Office.   This hotel seems to be an old style motel of years past, it lacks space where guests could sit down and enjoy a conversation. The rooms are adequate and clean with very little charm or personality.   We have only one complaint about the service. When we left we asked the reception personnel to call a Taxi to take us to the Anaheim Amtrak Station. We were offered two choices; a Yellow Cab, or a 15 dollars flat rate one, which we decided to take. However, by the end of the ride, the driver insisted that the cost was 20 dollars. We paid the extra five dollars just to avoid a confrontation. Was this due to ignorance of the Hotel's personnel?, or Dishonesty
Manager Response: none

Summary: My brother and I had stayed in the hotel several years ago, and were glad we could get reservations here for this trip.   From having our "special" requests honored (top floor, adjoining rooms) to the friendliness and helpfulness of all staff members we encountered, it was the best stay we've had in the Disneyland area. Hot breakfast every day was good, seemed to be choices for just about anyone. The pool was very clean and well-maintained.  It is so close to the entry of the parks that walking was a pleasure.  The fact that we could see the nightly Disneyland fireworks from our rooms was a bonus!  The only thing I could find any fault with at all was that the bathtub could probably use a refinishing.  That caused me no problems, it was just a cosmetic issue.  I would not
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am so glad that we chose this hotel. Everything was just right. The location can't be beat as it is literally across the street from Disneyland and saved us a ton on shuttles. There are also restaurants on either side of the hotel so you don't have to drive at all once you are there. The breakfast was way better than the standard hotel breakfasts. Lots of hot items and a fantastic variety. The rooms were very quiet and the salt water pool was great. Highly recommend.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location but in need of a renovation
Summary: Lets start with the bad. First of all the room is the smallest hotel room I stayed in during my visit to the USA. The bathroom was old and storage space was limited. For four people the room was quite cramped. The room had only one sink and no kitchen which was also inconvenient. By far the worst aspect of the room was the mouldy stench that permeated the air.   However despite the room issues breakfast is included which was quite good and there was a decent selection.   The saving grace of this hotel was the location!!! The hotel is opposite from the main entrance to Disneyland. This is perfect as it allows you to enter and leave the park as you please. It was a wonderful spot as it was in the middle of both theme parks.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in this Best Western during our visit to California. The hotel is clean, affordable, and right across the street from Disneyland.  It doesn't get any better than that.  The breakfast buffet was delicious with plenty of choices.  The staff at the front desk were very helpful.  And you can see the fireworks right in front of the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was my first pick and truly, a good one ! I had stayed at BW before and trusted I would find the same quality here. I wasn't disappointed. Moreover, this BW Plus Anaheim Inn is right in front of the Disney parks ! Super when you're tired from you day ! In addition, they have a good hot and cold breakfast with a nice room to eat it in and even a nice little terrasse with view on busy boulevard below ! The rooms were clean and nice with small fridge, microwave, flat-screen TV, good ventilation and everything in working order. Rooms are mostly at the back, away from street noise. Personnel very helpful when I had to find stamps and mail stuff and also when I needed and extra ticket for the Disney parks. Also, location is convenient for tour bus pick-ups, almost in front
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in this hotel on our recent visit to Disneyland following advice from the travel agent we booked through who always stays here. It is an older hotel but very clean and comfortable. The shower pressure was better than the five star hotel we came from in Dallas! The location to Disneyland is fantastic, just a short walk and you're there! It is also not to far to walk to CVS store for supplies. Breakfast was very nice with quite a few different choices. Nice to sit on balcony and eat breakfast! All the staff we dealt with were friendly and helpful. Enjoyed our stay and would definately stay again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Friendly employees, very good breakfast, clean rooms, quick response from employees for crib and bath mat. Left my pillow and called 5 hours later; they promised to ship it. Very happy with their response.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Best Western PLUS Anaheim Inn was the best value for our dollar. We have stayed at other hotels across from Disney and this was by far the best. The location is perfect (you can easily pop back in the afternoon for a break from the parks), the room was renovated and spacious, the continental breakfast in the morning hit the spot and we appreciated the free parking. We will definitely be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good deal for people who want close proximity to Disneyland.  Great front desk service, and nice ladies at door for breakfast.  The gentleman who does maintenance was fast and nice. The beds were small, but we made it work for 2 nights.  Towels were nice and a good shower head also.  Our room was clean, and we were happy to have a small refrigerator in the room too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Maid left her dirty glove on our toothbrushes. Did not accommodate scooter very well said we had to park it in the back of the hotel which we did not want to did not seem secure so they made us park it in our room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This will be the third time I have stayed at this hotel. They have updated it since my last visit and added the breakfast. I was nervous about what the breakfast would include (and if it would match the increase in price), but it was great! Definitely worth the extra a night to be able to have a decent breakfast each morning before heading to the park. I recommend this hotel to all my friends who are going to Disneyland. Manager Response: none

Summary: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland and LA sites. Motel is in a great location for walking to the Disney resort. Parking at the motel is tight, but available to you for no extra charge if using a rental car. Breakfast was a great way to start the morning all the essentials you would need.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very comfortable stay right next to Disney parks
Summary: This hotel doesn't have the most attractive d√©cor, but the service is friendly and efficient, the rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable, the wifi works, and the free breakfast is pretty tasty (includes eggs and sausage as well as the usual carbs).  It is a great place to rest and eat breakfast before tackling Disney.  It is an excellent location for walking to either Disneyland or Disney California Adventure - about five minutes walk along safe streets.  The rooms were quiet after about 10:00 pm, and the clean pool was a fun break from walking around the parks.  The advantage of this location is that it is easy to walk back to your room for an afternoon or pre-fireworks break.  The free parking was also excellent. We arrived at 11:00 am, and they let us park then even though
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a great place to stay. Reception staff were pleasant, helpful and efficient. The room was a reasonable size, clean and the bed was comfy. We thought we may have been disturbed by the air conditioning but after walking round Disney all day we were exhausted. The breakfast offering was good and continually replenished, there was a balcony where you could sit and eat outside which was pleasant. The hotel states that it is close to the entrance to Disney and that is certainly true. There are only one or two which are closer and the difference in walking distance is negligible. You could be in the park in no time at all and it was great to be able to leave the car for a couple of days. We really enjoyed our stay here and would certainly return if the opportunity arose.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you want a GREAT WALKING DISTANCE hotel for a Disneyland Resort Vacation Stay HERE!!  This is our Most Favorite Hotel  The Breakfast is Awesome!! Hot/Cold entrees, yogurt, eggs, meat, cereal, pastries, bagels, etc.  The staff is great and the rooms are comfortable.  Nothing fancy but your basic room.  We used 2 rooms and asked for adjoining doors so the grandparents could watch the grandkids while we went back to the park at night without leaving them alone.  There is also a suite available.  Best Value for the price.  True Walking Distance from Disneyland!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This Hotel is perfectly located for easy walking to the Disneyland Parks.  It is very clean and comfortable and the staff is friendly.  There is a very nice breakfast buffet included with the room.  It is our go-to hotel when we visit Anaheim.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed 2 nights for a short Disney vacation.  Perfect location for walking to Disney.  Good selection of breakfast items -- all ready for a quick morning meal.  Very friendly and kind staff.  Fridge, microwave and coffee maker in the room.  Free wi-fi worked well. It's not a posh place but it is clean, comfortable and safe.  Located nearby are a Dennys and a Tony Romas with a Panera opening soon.  Nice to have outside-the-park choices for eating.    The "Just-so-you-know's" about this property are:    -  Small pool area    -  Cramped parking lot    -  The air conditioning unit in my room was mounted up against the ceiling over the bathroom sink.  There was no way to adjust settings, I unplugged the thing overnight.  My stay was in late November, so not too big a hassle.  I would
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location, Hot free breakfast. Very satisfied!!! The only issue that drove us crazy were the people above us who let their children run around their room. Also kids running outside in the halls. Extremely difficult to rest. The beds are super hard as well. Wish they would correct this. Frank from maintenance provides outstanding customer service!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This property is excellent.  Great location for Disneyland as well as walking to the convention center.  Staff goes out of their way to make sure your stay is 100% perfect!  Would definitely stay again.  Breakfast room is beautiful and excellent choices of item on the buffet.
Manager Response: none

Summary: So convenient to go to Disneyland and downtown Disney. Excellent breakfast and nice room. Would stay again . Nice to go for hot tub after long day in Disney.  Having fridge and microwave good value for money.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value and location for Disneyland
Summary: Great location with easy walking access to Disneyland as well as restaurants.  Each room has a microwave and fridge so that families can keep some food in their rooms.  Breakfast is included.  Customer service is top notch.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We thoroughly enjoy staying at this location.  We feel very comfortable and safe here.  It is just a very short distance from the main gate at Disneyland, so if needed you can return quickly without having to wait for a shuttle.  We have really enjoyed the new breakfast room and all of the good food that is available and a great variety as well.  Love this place!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was inexpensive and in the best location to the Disneyland Parks.  We just crossed the street and we were in the parks which it what we wanted.  The room was okay in size and it was clean.  We didn't need anything grand, as we were not spending much time in the hotel room, so it served its purpose.  I would stay here again for convenience and would recommend it!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here on a recent visit during the Halloweentime festivities at Disneyland. The room was what we expected given the price. Decor, carpet and furnishings were a bit dated but, clean. Upon initially entering the room it was a bit musty but, after running the AC for a bit it seemed to improve. If they would replace the trim and doors in the rooms (versus the layers and years of paint)it would breathe immediate new life. The one area needing the most TLC was the bathroom. While it was clean there was no working fan and the wallpaper in the shower area was bubbling from the moisture. We found the location of our room  (on the 3rd floor) to be quiet and the perfect viewing area for the nightly fireworks.   The property is extremely well situated and is less than a 10 minute
Manager Response: I hope to see you next year for the Disney Halloween Fun.

Summary: The place was dirty and it had bugs! It was horrible just like the time i took my family there for a visit back in april of 2014. I thought they would have improved since all the construction was taking place when i was there but it hasn't
Manager Response: I'm sorry you were so disappointed with your stays.  Had I had been aware of how unhappy you were,  I would have made ever attempt to correct the problems.

Summary: This is a nice hotel... room was okay nothing too special.. it was clean and perfect to rest after walking all day. Free parking was awesome. I parked early around 10 am. I checked in at 3 pm and when I checked out 2 days later I was able to leave my car parked until 6 pm for no cost. The continental breakfast was good, it had many things to choose from. I also liked that the room includes a microwave, it's very useful. Last year my family and I stayed at the disneyland hotel paid way more and parking/breakfast was not included and there was nothing special about that hotel either. I thought the walk from disneyland hotel to the parks was further than the walk from this hotel to the parks. Also when we stayed at the disneyland hotel We had went out to eat my son fell asleep so I
Manager Response: Happy to hear that you had a good experience at the Anaheim Inn.  Hope you'll be back next year.

Summary Heading: Average hotel, not as nice as the surrounding hotels
Summary: The rate was competitive but the bathroom was disgusting (bugs, mold, hair) and super small. The breakfast was the highlight of our stay here, very impressive! I would recommend the other hotels nearby over this one. Staff was very nice.
Manager Response: I am happy to say that we will be redoing our bathrooms next year.  So next time ask for a room with a new bathroom!

Summary: We ended up staying only 1 night at this hotel because we decided to add an extra night to our trip & this was one of the few places to still have a room available. (We must have been lucky & snagged a cancelation because they're already booked up for when our next trip is!) Overall we loved it, I almost wish our whole stay had been here! The room was very clean & the hotel seemed quiet. The bed was very comfy. The front desk staff was very friendly! The breakfast was very good, the day we stayed it offered scrambled eggs, sausage, & roasted potatoes as well as danishes, donuts, toast, english muffins, bagels, & cereal. They also had coffee & juices. The breakfast room is located on the 3rd floor in front of the hotel & offered outdoor seating that looks right at the parks! It
Manager Response: I'm so glad you decided to stay an extra night.  I hope you start with us next trip.
