Summary: We have stayed at three properties near Disneyland and prefer this location. The amenities are similar to the another nearby Best Western but the breakfast is better here. Otherwise, it's a clean room in a hotel that was recently renovated and a short walk to the parks.
Manager Response: I'm glad you like our breakfast, see you next time.

Summary: The location cannot be beaten - just a short walk from Disney so you can save all your energy for the parks. We could watch the fireworks from our room in the evening. (3rd floor near breakfast room - thumbs up!) Breakfast is convenient and all included in the price. I would guess the breakfast items were probably heated up rather than cooked from scratch but there was a fair selection of hot and cold items every day and we saved money eating at the hotel each morning. Our daughter was a bit transfixed by the TV in the dining room showing cartoons. The bedroom decor is not very stylish and a bit tired but you get everything you need for a hotel of this price range. The air conditioning is noisy so we left ours off at night. We think this place is great value and have stayed here
Manager Response: Thank you for your loyalty.  We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Had the pleasure of staying here last month to visit Disneyland. So convenient and the Best Western staff friendly and hospitable. Best western are pretty much always clean and comfortable. We were able to watch the Fireworks from Disneyland from outside our room at night.
Manager Response: It's nice to watch the fireworks without the crowds.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: Stayed here 4 nights for Disneyland- can't beat location literally a 2 minute walk to parks and amazing not having to drive back and forth and night or wait for a bus when tired after parks all day. Great breakfast with lots of selection and hotel seems very secure and safe. Good hot tub and pool too which is nice after being in parks all day. Bed comfortable my only complaint would be our room smelled like urine after coming back each time no matter how much perfume was sprayed and that was a bit odd- room extremely clean just the urine smell was gross. Also would have been nice for hotel to let us know that our room was right below breakfast area since every day at 6:30am we woke up to people above scooting chairs and tables across floor and was very loud and hard to sleep
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear of the odor in the room, No one should stay in a room they are not happy in. I hope that you mentioned it during your stay so we could have moved you and resolved the problem for future guests.  I do hope you will consider staying with us again in the future.

Summary: The location was so easy to get to Disney. It was great not having to get in the car the whole weekend. The Breakfast Buffet that you offer was excellent. Starts your day off right. You save money and everyone likes to save money. Great job! Thanks.
Manager Response: They say that breakfast is the most important meal of the day.  I'm glad you enjoyed ours.

Summary: If you are going to Disneyland then this is a great place to stay. Location, location, location. Right across the street. Just a 5 min walk. Older hotel but clean and comfortable. The breakfast was nice for a quick bite before hitting the parks. Overall a nice place.
Manager Response: It really is about the location.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: This is my go-to hotel when traveling to Anaheim.  The entire staff are always friendly and accommodating.  While the 2 double rooms are a bit small, I would be hard pressed to find something to complain about.  The breakfast is about the best you'll get at any hotel (that doesn't cook to order).  It's spacious (a plus to me!), well stocked and has a wide variety of items.  The beds are wonderful and I can always count on a great night's sleep! Here's a little hint:  at night, go up to the 3rd floor to get a spectacular view of Disneyland!
Manager Response: Like you, I'd prefer to have queen beds but unfortunately our rooms would not accommodate them.  I hope that the new breakfast room makes up for it.  Thanks for your loyalty!

Summary: Walk to Disneyland from hotel is about 5 minutes. So convenient!!! No waiting for shuttles. FREE parking and free breakfast! We would eat a full breakfast each morning before we went to Disney (what a money saver!). The staff at the hotel were so friendly and accommodating. They made us feel welcome and like they would be willing to help us with anything we needed and they did it with a great attitude. We had a 3rd floor room and could see the Disney Fireworks from our room! Our room was clean with no issues. This is an older hotel but for the price, cleanliness, and location across the street from Disneyland it was perfect. I would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We stayed here back in the end of September 2015. I booked this hotel at last minute for a disneyland trip. This hotel wasn't originally where I wanted to book through, but I'm glad I did.   PROS: We were running really behind and didn't check in till 12 hrs after check in time. But as soon as we arrived our room was ready for us to crash. About a 5 min walk to disneyland which was a plus, especially with a 4 yr old. Went back to the room couple times during our stay to take a short nap.  Breakfast was provided. Decent breakfast with eggs, sausage, pancakes, some pastries and fruits. Just enough to fill up your belly for the morning.   Staff was very friendly, and always had a smile and greeted you properly.  CONS: Only problem we had was when we checked in, someone left the
Manager Response: I happy you didn't go with your original plans and instead stayed with us.  Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Always stay at this hotel when making a trip to Disneyland. The rooms are comfortable, the breakfast is yummy and the staff is awesome.  This hotel is across the street from Disneyland which is great especially at the end of the night when you are tired. Would hightly recommend it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your loyalty, we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Literally 10 minute walk to gate of Disneyland.  There are suites that can hold a bigger family. We could see the fireworks of disneyland from out hotel room-no need to fight the crowds.  Good breakfast.  You can take the Greyline Company express from LAX which drops and picks up about 100 feet up the sidewalk from the hotel (out in front of the other Best Western).  round trip $48. Kids free. Walk west and turn the corner and there is a Cheesecake Factory. No need to pay Disneyland inflate prices. We also ate at the Denny's adjacent to the hotel and saved money.  Outdoor pool slightly cold, but it was October. There is a resort fee, but I guess all hotels  have them.
Manager Response: It sounds like you took advantage of all that's around us.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: Best location to walk to Disneyland.  Great showers, beds and quiet enough to get some rest before your next adventure into Disneyland the next day.  No parking hassles or shuttles need to be taken.  This place is perfect.  Eating your free breakfast on the street balcony is fun.  Can watch the employees skateboard to work in the morning.
Manager Response: I see you stayed with us during our construction, thanks for coming back!

Summary: Great location to Disneyland and local restaurant.  Hotel was good.  They say queen beds but more like full size.  Very uncomfortable to sleep two full adults.  I would stay again if they had bigger beds.
Manager Response: You are correct the beds are full size, my apologies if you were told they were queens.  We advertise doubles so no one is disappointed.  Again my apologies.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while attending a meeting at the nearby Anaheim convention center. My family was able to take advantage of its close proximity to the Disneyland Resort during my meetings. The breakfast room is wonderful and I enjoyed the fact that the hotel changed some of the breakfast items from the first day to the next, to keep the selections varied.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I look forward to our next visit!
Manager Response: It's great when you can mix business and pleasure and there is no better place than Anaheim with the Convention Center and Disneyland across the street from each other.  Thanks for bringing the family.

Summary Heading: Our stay at the Best Western Anaheim Inn
Summary: We stayed at the Anaheim Inn for 3 nights.  We flew into LAX and got a shuttle to the hotel.  The guests services were friendly and our room was ready when we arrived.  Exhausted after a day of travel, we relaxed a bit and decided to go to Downtown Disney for lunch.  We came back to the hotel and crashed.  The next morning, we met our son and DIL for breakfast at the BW Anaheim buffet located on the third floor.  I must say, it was one of the best buffets I have been to at a Best Western Hotel.  If you have a family with small children, this is the place for you.  The offerings were hearty and tasty.  Before you go into the buffet, you must show them your room key and your hotel room number.  We would definitely go back to this hotel and stay if we ever get back to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thanks for your great description of our breakfast!  It's over a year old but we're still excited about it.  I'm glad you enjoyed it.

Summary: We had a room second floor near the front; nice after a long day at the parks. The room was clean and comfy. Location was about a 10 minute walk to the park entrance. Good selection of breakfast items. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend for anyone wanting to stay near the magic!
Manager Response: And magic it is!

Summary: The hotel was ok, I like the Best Western Park Place Inn and Mini Suites better.  These rooms are outdated, no central A/C.  They would not let us take breakfast items back to our rooms, we have to get "permission" and then they had an employee follow us back to the room with the food.  Also, many crickets in the room and bathroom, and the beds are horrible.
Manager Response: Sorry to hear that we did not live up to your expectations.

Summary: This was a great place to stay during our visit to Disneyland.  It's across the road from the entrance to the park and has a pool for when it gets too hot at the park.  The breakfast was okay, not great.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: I chose this inn because it was very convenience to walk to Disneyland. I traveled with 2 boys and have 4 luggage for our 25 day journey in West Coast. During our stay, we planned to go to SD only for an overnight stay then come back to Anaheim before going to our next stop, Las Vegas. It would not be handy for me to bring all the luggage with us only for 1 day night stop in San Diego. Therefore, I asked the supervisor if they could keep our luggage only for 1 day. She said there was no room for keeping those luggage unless I was willing to pay 1 day extra for the room, but unfortunately they were all booked up. They could only keep luggage for a day, but not overnight. I promised there would be no valuable in our luggage only clothes and they could keep them in the same storage
Manager Response: My apologies for not being able to accommodate your request for luggage storage.  We do work with our guests and will make exceptions when we can but unfortunately were unable to keep your luggage overnight after you checked out.  I understand your displeasure with this Best Western but please keep in mind that all Best Westerns are independently owned and operated and policies will vary from property to property.

Summary Heading: Just what we needed. Staff made this visit for Us.
Summary: Booked 6 nights here as the Location was right across the road from the entrance. 5 mins door to door. Plenty of parking if you have a car. More of a Motel style hotel. Check in was fast and our room as ready early and could go in straight away on arrival. Our room was a good size with 2 queen beds. Microwave, fridge etc. Our room was towards the back of the property so it was quiet. Bathroom was small and a few small dead bugs in the bath which I washed down the sink. Tv was a good size. I was hoping for more of a healthy breakfast with more fruit and not so much sugary cereal and pastries etc. There was lots of breakfast choices to choose from just not what Australians would call Healthy. I had toast every day with Vegemite I brought from home. The breakfast never ran out and
Manager Response: We are hearing that our guests want more healthy choices and we are looking into doing just that. Thank you for your comments.

Summary: So many restaurants and shops nearby made for convenience for the elderly who cannot walk very far. The breakfast which was included in the tarriff was quite adequate, and the elevators meant that there was no problem getting to the upper floors.
Manager Response: We are lucky to have so many restaurants and shops close by.

Summary: Very good hotel with free hot breakfast.  Good service and friendly staff.  There is an elevator plus outside stairs to get between floors. There is a small refrigerator and a microwave in every room.  It is close to the entrance of Disneyland,  California Adventure, and Downtown Disney plus the shopping and dining of Garden Walk.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: The location for a Disney trip is perfect  - across the road from the main gates. The rooms are a bit small, but clean & tidy. Breakfast is included & is fairly good & an ideal meal prior to a big day at Disneyland. There is also a laundry on site which is very convenient & the pool is good. Overall, the Anaheim Inn is very good value for those on a budget & looking for an excellent location.
Manager Response: I'm happy that our location helped make your trip special.

Summary: This is the best kept secret of the Disneyland Resort! It's literally across the street from the resort entrance, with great prices, the best staff and a wonderful breakfast! My family is already planning our next trip.
Manager Response: Please give me a call when making your next reservations.

Summary Heading: Great value just in font of the gate of Disneyland
Summary: We have at 10:00 AM and park the Car and walk right to the gate of California Adventure land. at the next day we checked out at 10:00 AM but aloud to keep the parking spot until 6;00 PM at no charge. This was a saving of $34 for two (2) days parking. great savings at great convenience.
Manager Response: Parking does add up!  I'm glad we had space when you arrived early.

Summary Heading: Good value for Disneyland Resort area, close to main gate
Summary: I read the reviews for all kinds of hotels in the Disneyland area before choosing this one.  Some charged for parking.  I chose this facility based on its proximity to Disneyland's main gate, the breakfast, and the reviews I read about it.  There were 3 adults in our party, and we were all very pleased.  It was clean, comfortable, well maintained.  The breakfast was good--nicely prepared hot options as well the usual quick cold choices.  I had friends staying at one of the Disney hotels--for all they paid for the room, they still had to pay for parking and didn't have free breakfast.  Overall, we were very pleased with our choice.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Inn, I'm glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: I recently visited with my family (wife and 3 year old) and overall this was a great place to stay.  About a 10 minute walk to Disneyland, California Adventure, and Downtown Disney with other shopping and restaurants within walking distance as well.  The rooms aren't fancy, but are clean and comfortable.  The staff was helpful and friendly, each time we turned down house keeping someone would call to see if we needed anything.  The included breakfast was great with eggs, ham or sausage on alternating days, fresh fruit, breakfast potatoes, waffles or pancakes (also alternating days), toast, yogurt, cereal, doughnuts and pastries, milk, juice, coffee, plenty of options to help you start your day.  The pool and hot tub were great, especially after a long day at Disneyland.  We were
Manager Response: I glad you enjoyed your stay, thank you for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Free Parking and Close to Disneyland!
Summary: The Best Western Plus is an older motel, but clean and friendly staff.   The walk to Disneyland is easy, just across the street.  It's a walk, but as close as you can get!   It is one of the few hotels that doesn't hit you for extra "parking fee" which is a plus, so the price is the price.   They have a breakfast in the morning that was really rather good.   I have celiac, so the bread, waffle, pancake and cereals are out for me, but they had fruit, yogurt, juice, eggs, meat and potatoes, so there was plenty for getting that energy in before the day!  We're making another trip, and I'd be glad to stay here again!
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear we had what you needed for breakfast.

Summary: On our most recent visit to Disneyland we stayed at the Best Western Plus right across from the park.  I was reluctant because  we stayed at a different hotel last year and had no problems there.  On this trip everyone here was friendly and helpful.  During our trips to our free breakfast and on our way to the park everyone would smile and say "good morning", the front desk was friendly and helpful and called on days we declined housekeeping to see if we needed anything.  The included breakfast saved us time and money.  Every morning we would fill up on eggs, sausage or ham, potatoes, juice, milk, cereal, toast, yogurt, fresh fruit, take your pick they had plenty of options.  The pool area was nice and included a hot tub that was great after a long day at Disney.  The rooms
Manager Response: Thanks for giving us a try, I hope we'll see you and your family back next year.

Summary: Great place to stay, especially when you have played all day at the Disney Resort or any of the other fun things to do locally. The staff is very friendly and great at what they do.  The breakfast bar is wonderful.  Nothing like rolling out of bed & having a breakfast all ready to eat. You name it they almost have it to eat.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments about my staff, I'll pass them on!

Summary: This hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland.  It has a pool and hot tub which we did not use, but saw other customers enjoying the pool.  If you get fatigued at Disneyland all day, you'll have a short walk to the hotel and melt into the bed to relax.  We found this hotel to be fairly quiet and relaxing.  The breakfast offered was excellent.  Save your money and don't go to Denny's next door, Best Western breakfast will save you $$$$.  Very family friendly.
Manager Response: Don't know if Denny's would like to hear your comments but I'm glad you were able to save some money by having breakfast with us.

Summary: Great hotel. Very close to disneyland. Great breakfast and nearby you find lots of restaurants. You can even hear the disneyland parade at night. It is very close. Very good hotel clean and has a pool.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us we appreciate your loyalty.

Summary: Great hotel with a very easy walk to Disneyland. Friendly staff. Good breakfast. My only drawback was having to move my car by 6:00 pm. Most hotels I've stayed at in this area offer extended parking until after the parks close.
Manager Response: We'd like to be able to let you park after 6pm, day of departure but we need to be able to provide parking for our arriving guests.  I'm sorry if it presented a problem for you and your grandson.

Summary Heading: Very nice stay for Disneyland trip
Summary: I cannot say enough about how conveniently located this hotel is. We loved being able to walk out our door and in less than 10 minutes we were at the park gates.   We arrived at the hotel very early in the morning to pickup our pre-ordered stroller from City Strollers at the reception area. We understood that it was too early to check in, and we really appreciated that the hotel let us park our car in the lot. They do not always have extra parking, as the parking is pretty tight, but it made a huge difference for our morning and early start at the park. We had reserved adjoining rooms for additional family members and left their information with the front desk. Our family members had no issues checking in separately and were able to leave their bags in their car, as they were
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear that we had space for you to park your car prior to your check in.  It doesn't always happen that way but we are glad to let our guests park early when we have the spaces available.

Summary Heading: Excellent Place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We had 3 rooms at this hotel and took two of our married children and their 7 children.  It is right across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  The hotel was clean, comfortable, and had a great breakfast area.    The staff was exceptional.  We will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: I hope you were able to get some of our connecting rooms while you were here.  Thanks for bring your family to the Anaheim Inn.

Summary: Quality Room for the price, a great location next to Disneyland so just a short walk away, provide and nice breakfast in an enjoyable dinning area and enjoyable location for a getaway. Nice relaxing spa and swimming pool.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us, hope you'll be back again soon.

Summary: I just returned from three nights at the Anaheim Inn. What a joy! The hotel is right across the street from Disneyland! Denny's is next door. The beds are SO comfortable. The new breakfast room is roomy and the food was good. Parking and breakfast are included. There is a real pride of ownership in this place. I saw two men walking around replacing bulbs - a small thing, but necessary. The pool was great for my granddaughter. We had it to ourselves Wednesday morning. Overall, really nice people, good rooms and GREAT beds!
Manager Response: I'm so glad you and your granddaughter had such a good time and even managed to have the pool all to yourselves.  That must have been great after dealing with so many folks at Disneyland!

Summary: This place was amazing. Clean, comfy, not too small, close to food and Disneyland. Easy walk for young kids. Great breakfast wonderful staff!  Nice pool. Recommend to family's decent price. We will stay there again! During half marathon provided early morning snacks!  Great hotel!
Manager Response: Will you be coming back for the Avengers Marathon on November?  Hope to see you then.

Summary Heading: Mickey is just across the street!
Summary: The Best Western Anaheim Inn is the place to stay while visiting Disneyland.  It is less than a half block walk to the cross street/light that takes you into Disneyland.  This last year the hotel has added a breakfast bar (free breakfast!) and an exercise room.  Right next to the hotel is a Tony Romo's and, on the other side (closer to Disney) is a Denny's.  There, with your hotel card, a 20% discount is given for your meals.  There are many people who go to Disneyland, leave the park to eat at Denny's, e go back to their hotel room for a quick rest or nap.  It is easily done with Best Western Anaheim Inn's  proximity!
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear you enjoyed your stay and that you took advantage of the discounts available at the neighboring restaurants. Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: We have stayed at this location before and will continue to stay here. The staff at the front desk are very helpful with questions you may have, answering questions about the different tours, booking the super shuttle to the airport, going to dinner and many more. The housekeeping staff are very quick at making sure your room is done, just in time for a nap after your day at Disneyland. We would recommend this location any time and every time.
Manager Response: We appreciate your loyalty and look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We stay at this hotel everytime we visit Disneyland!!!!!  We love this location as it is only a short walking distance from the main gate.  The staff are always very helpful, courteous and accommodating.  The breakfast room is an additional plus.  Plenty of things to choose from always fresh and hot.  They keep it very clean as well.  We feel very safe and welcomed at this property and highly recommend it if you are staying in the area.
Manager Response: Thanks for your recommendation, so glad you like the Anaheim Inn.

Summary: We stay here ALL the time. We visit Disneyland about 4-5 times a year and always stay here. It is a prefect distance. You can park there in the morning, come back to check in and keep the car there until 6pm the following day. The breakfast was yummy and the staff was amazing. Sue the manager made sure I was taken care of when I had any issues.... I ALWAYS stay here and will continue to ALWAYS stay here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your loyalty!  When's your next visit?

Summary: This is such a great place to stay for a Disneyland visit. Closer to the parks than 2 of the Disney Hotels plus free breakfast! Great staff, clean rooms, what more could you ask for? We stayed as a family of 4 for 4 night in September for the half marathon weekend. The staff was awesome and they even opened the breakfast area really early to accomodate all the runners who needed food before the race start. They really go beyond the call....
Manager Response: Hope to see you at the next marathon!

Summary: I booked this hotel as a package through Costco.  I read so many reviews and they ranged from not so good to great, but the price and location was desirable so I booked it.  This was a mother daughter trip, my daughter's 20th bday is in a few weeks and she is about to leave for her second year of college so we decided to take an adventure!  Here are the positives: Check in was a breeze, the room was clean, the walk to the park was super easy and quick, the breakfast was decent and the workers in the breakfast room were friendly. Here are the negatives:  The walls seem to be paper thin, we were in a second level room surrounded by rooms on all sides, you could here toilets flushing and showers running at all hours, not to mention kids running about and traffic/car horns.  So the
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear of the problems you encountered during your stay here.  I know we can't be everything to everybody and I'm happy to hear you found other accommodations you were happy with.

Summary: This hotel is 5 minutes from the gate!  The location made it super easy for me to walk back to the hotel to drop off extra packages or to change after all the wet rides.  Too lazy to carry it all.  The breakfast options were fabulous!  My family always love a hot breakfast to start off the day.  They have scrambled eggs, sausages, pancakes, waffles, and lots of breads and pastries.    The room was comfortable and clean, but it's old and small.  Had trouble with where to put our suitcases.  The air conditioning unit was loud.  We had to turn it off at bedtime.  Also, had a bit of a musky smell, so we just had to open the door to air it out.  Made sure to put the security latch on.    On our next visit to Disneyland, we will be back.
Manager Response: SO glad you enjoyed our breakfast.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: The hotel had a great hot breakfast. It was super close to Disneyland front gates. The rooms were clean and roomy. The  beds were comfortable. The vanity had bright lights and was separate from the bathroom. The room had air conditioning and heating. I would definately stay here again!
Manager Response: We're looking forward to your next stay!

Summary: Great stay during disneyland trip. Hotel just down the street from Disneyland. Great pool to cool off in after a hot day at the park. Good breakfast selection. Can see fireworks from hotel. This is one of the best valued Disneyland good neighbor hotels that I could find.
Manager Response: I'm glad you found us, thanks for staying at the Anaheim Inn.

Summary: Our experience was very pleasant.  The rooms are very clean, the staff is friendly and professional, the breakfast was delicious served in a new remodeled room.  I love the location, just across the street from Disneyland.  It was very convenient and we were able to go to our room for the kids naps everyday very easily.
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear you had a pleasant stay and that you took advantage of our location so the kids could nap everyday.  It makes a difference.

Summary Heading: Best Place To Stay For Disneyland
Summary: I don't write reviews often, but felt the need to write one for my recent stay at the Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn.   Checked in late on a Friday night, was greeted by a friendly face and knowledgeable employee at the counter which was a treat after traveling all day. Room was well kept, internet was fast and easy to access, I even really liked the shampoo and conditioner, both smelled great. Bed was comfy, a/c was awesome ( it was REALLY hot this weekend).   We came for Disneyland. We needed to make sure we had a good breakfast to sustain us through the hot hot weather this particular weekend. The breakfast bar (complimentary with your stay by the way) was a God send. The food was great, lots of options; WAY better than Dennys next door. Folks from other hotels were trying to
Manager Response: You did pick one of the hottest weekends of the year to stay with us.  I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay, please come back and stay with us again when it's not so hot!

Summary: This was very convenient to Disney, just a short walk.  It has FREE parking which is a plus.  Great breakfast in the mornings, and ample space to eat, including a balcony.  My only complaint was not enough plug ins.  The plug ins were poor, , phone charger would pop out.  This is an older hotel, so it is to be expected, but so many now have plugin in the lamps. Pool and hot tub were ok.  We could see some of the fireworks from the pool.  Everyone was very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: We do have a plug in for 4 devices on the side of the desk but I do know that with all the electronics we all have now there are never enough.  Something to look into, thank you for mentioning it.

Summary: Stayed here just the one night while visiting Disneyland.  Hotel itself is excellent, clean, large rooms and good breakfast.  The location is literally across the road from the Disneyland entrance, and is probably closer to the entry to the parks than some of the Disney hotels for a fraction of the price.  Hotel staff were very good in checking us in early and allowing us to park while we went to visit the park and get the most of our money.  Also very helpful in advising us where to go in park and to buy tickets from them rather than Disney as same price but no queue.  Would definitely stay again even if not visiting Disney.
Manager Response: I'm glad we were able to help you with your Disney tickets. Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: Pros:  Literally a 5 min walk to Disneyland  comparable price to other area hotels  Good breakfast buffet   Clean and comfortable rooms  Cons:    Our room was directly under breakfast room which meant we were woken up at 6am to hear them setting up (very loud) every day. Not a big problem if you are planning to get up early for a day at the park, but not great if you were looking forward to sleeping in after getting back from the park at 1 am.   Not very secure, we locked ourselves out of our room and were given a new key at front desk without even being asked for ID  The shower in our room was a walk in shower, which was nice and big, but poorly designed in that there was no slope to the floor drain so when we took a shower the whole bathroom floor would turn into a big puddle.
Manager Response: Please accept my sincere apology for the problems you had while staying with us.  It sounds like fell short of your family's expectations.  Your security is very important and apologize for not following procedure when you were issued new keys. By you making me aware of the problem, I can address the issue so that it won't happen again. Thank you for bring it to my attention.  I do hope you and your family will give us another opportunity on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: Across Disneyland main gate and breakfast was a + with friendly breakfast staff.  This was a family vacation and with a toddler it makes it extremely convenient to head back to take a quick break or retrieve anything that was left behind.  Breakfast was above average with warm food like scrambled or patty eggs, waffles, pancakes, seasoned baked potatoes, sausages. And English muffin, pastries and doughnuts. Breakfast was welcoming and professional they delivered a lot of food choices for the price.
Manager Response: I so glad you enjoyed our breakfast and that you were able to take advantage of our location to come back during the day.  Sometimes it not just the toddler that needs a break.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: We choose this hotel for a two night stay while our family to visited Disneyland. We choose it based on the Tripadvisor reviews. The reviews were correct. We loved the convenience of being across the street. We were at Disneyland when it opened. We came back to the hotel at 2PM when it started getting crowded and hot. We went swimming and took a nap. We went to dinner at Bubba Gumps.  At 7PM we went back to Disneyland and stayed until it closed at midnight.
Manager Response: It's all about the location, thank you for choosing us.

Summary: Great location! Great room! Great staff! We really appreciated the proactive customer service of calling our room shortly after check in to confirm that our room was satisfactory (it was!) The location is great!  Our son enjoyed the pool and the room was comfortable, clean and quiet.  The breakfast room was clean and the staff great.  We felt we got great value for our stay and would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words, I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: Arrived at 2am and manager extremely helpful after our long haul from Australia.  Room was comfortable and well serviced.  Breakfast area was bright and airy balcony area was great to relax over meal. Nice touch having Disney movies playing inside. All staff were friendly and helpful.  We didn't have time to try the pool and exercise area. Enjoyable stay
Manager Response: I've been on that long flight from Australia, I'm happy to hear that my staff took good care of you,  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: Perfect location for Disney - with parking until 6pm on check-out day which is good.  Generally well-run - addition of breakfast since our last visit is welcome and breakfast choices are pretty good for a free buffet.  Check-in etc organised well.  Only real problem we had was late cleaning of our room (a pain to have to vacate or pass up cleaning when returning from the parks at the hottest time of the day - i.e. 2-3pm).  They did have an issue with the hot water whilst we were there but this was well dealt with (good communication and problem resolved).  Would not consider anywhere else for Disney.
Manager Response: In your future travels know that you can request the service of your room at any time so you are not inconvenienced. I'm sorry there was a problem during your stay.  It would have been nice to get back to a cool room during that week when it was so hot. Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: The worst Hotel I've ever been to  At arrival, the sink was full of water with no drainage. Tried to call the reception but the phone was not working either. Tried to connect to the internet, but that was't working either. Decided to go to bed, so went to have a shower, but there was no hot water, only nice freezing water.   So I strongly suggest that you stay away from this hotel as they have the worst possible imaginable service. Try a motel or a camping, you will definitely have a better service and more value for your money.
Manager Response: I would love the opportunity to hear from you regarding your stay so that I can better understand what went so wrong. No one should have to experience what you did. Please accept my sincere apologies. Please email me at sedwards@anaheiminn.com.  Thank you.

Summary: This hotel had it's definite advantages- it's only one block from the main entrance of Disneyland.  So, you don't need to pay for parking.  Plus, there is a great breakfast offered every morning until 10am- which saved us money on breakfast for everyone!  The downside was that the room smelled moldy- like the carpets had been cleaned, but not properly dried or something?  But we spent so little time in the room, it didn't bother us too much.
Manager Response: There are time when we will shampoo in the mornings and rent the room in the afternoon, in an effort to keep the carpets fresh for the next guest.  My apologies if there was an odor.  I hope you'll be back to see us on your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Clean Rooms and Good Free Breakfast
Summary: The Anaheim Inn (Best Western) is partially newly renovated and at least those rooms are tastefully completed with comfortable best, updated room decor and bathroom tile and paint. The complementary breakfast has more choices than expected, including warm eggs, potatoes and meat choice as well as breads, cereals and pastries. They even have some outside seating, The proximity to Disney can't be beat. The parking is free but limited and the staff was courteous and helpful. This was our second year and a fun way to visit Disney for multiple days.
Manager Response: Sounds like you stayed in one of the room we remodeled when we added the breakfast room.  I glad you liked it.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Second Time Staying Here - Just as pleased as before!
Summary: We stayed here for convenience to Disneyland, and near the Anaheim Convention Center where the D23 Expo being held this year. The hotel was just a few minutes from the entrance to Disneyland,and a few block walk to the convention.center. The location came in handy, as the area was experiencing record heat and we could go back to our room for a break.  The rooms were clean and comfortable, fridge, microwave also available in our room.  The carpet looked a little dated, but when walking around in my socks, they did not get dirty.  The only glitch we had was we saw a big bug on on the floor the day we left, but it was hot out and we figured they might be coming inside due to the heat!  The complimentary breakfast, we thought was great! You can have a good breakfast to start the day
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us during the D23 Expo. I apologize for the unexpected guest in your room but as you said everyone was looking for a cool spot that weekend.  Hope to see you next year for the Expo.

Summary: We stayed here for four days. 2 minutes walk to the park gates. Rooms are decent with enough space, but the carpet is worn out and looked dirty in places. Not up to the standard of other Best Western hotels I have stayed before.
Manager Response: My apologies for the condition of the carpet in your room.  We have an ongoing shampoo program but I realize, especially during the summer months, that we don't get to them fast enough.  I hope that you will give us another try.

Summary: Great room with lots of space. Plenty of amenities. It stays cool in the summer when it is extremely hot out. The beds are really comfy and they have a lot of pillows. It is really close to the park so it is easy to go back and forth if you need a rest or just want to drop things of in your room. The complimentary breakfast is great and they have both inside and balcony type seating outside. great way to wake up and start a day. Overall a great stay.
Manager Response: I have to agree with you, the balcony is the best place to sit for breakfast.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: I booked this hotel for the following reasons: 1. It was close to Disneyland, 2. It was a reputable chain and 3. The photos showed a clean and modern hotel. Sadly it only managed to achieve the first. The room was tired and needed redecorating badly. The carpets were dirty, the air conditioning was noisy and rattled excessively, the pool directly overlooked the car park, so not private in any way. I would have thought a company this size would not compromise on their standards hence booking with a reputable chain - how wrong was I. Thankfully it was close to Disneyland so the main function was served. I would hazard a guess that the hotel survives off its close proximity to the resort otherwise I'm sure they would not have been as busy as they were.
Manager Response: Please accept my sincere apology for not living up to your expectations.  I understand we can't be everything to everybody and if I had been aware that you were not happy with the accommodations I would have been happy to assist you in finding lodging more suitable to your needs.

Summary: Possibly the closest non-Disney hotel which makes it very nice to return during the busiest hottest time of day to rest and cool off in their salt water pool before returning for the evening shows.  Complimentary hot breakfast with many options saves you time.  Clean, friendly...only the coffee was definitely not satisfactory.  We would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear that you didn't like our coffee, it may be time to look into something new.  Thank you for your comments.

Summary: My husband and I visit Disneyland once every year and always look for a hotel that is within walking distance,  cost effective, quiet, and clean.  This hotel not only met all of my expectations but exceeded them.    The best part of this hotel is definitely the distance to Disneyland. It is pretty much right across the street and takes about 3-5 minutes to walk to the gates.  The room was very clean and the rates were about $150.00 a night during the busiest month of the year. After comparing the rates to others in the surrounding area I was happy to give this place a shot.   They do offer free parking until 6pm on the day of check out,  free WiFi, and a very nice continental breakfast. Actually the breakfast was much more than we expected and was served until 10am every day.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words, I look forward to your next stay.

Summary: I felt the rooms were a little bit run down.  The carpets were dirty and the wall paper in the bathroom were peeling off the walls.  It felt very, "1 star" if you will. However, the bedding was very clean and the staff was very friendly.  We usually really enjoy our stays at Best Westerns, but we won't return to this one.  Bummer.
Manager Response: My apologies for not living up to your expectations.  We plan to do some updating to your rooms over this coming year.  I hope that you will give us another chance.

Summary: This location is better then most BW we have stayed at. This BW location is directly across the street from Disney, and did not charge a fee for parking, that is the main reason we stayed at this location.  The A/C unit rattle and hummed all night long and if it wasn't for being completely exhausted, from being at Disneyland for 15 hrs each day it would have kept me up
Manager Response: My apologies for the loud air conditioner.  I hope that you let us know so we were able to fix or replace it for you.

Summary Heading: 2 great nights/3 awesome days at Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at the Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn on our very recent trip to Disneyland. We spent two nights with our two kids (3.5 year old and 16 month old). The staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to Disneyland (across the street) so it was VERY convenient. We also had free parking and were able to leave our car on the premises till 6pm the day we checked out which was very helpful. The breakfast was great. We really enjoyed our stay there and would highly recommend the hotel for anyone looking for a place to stay when at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying us.  I hope this will your place to stay when ever your family comes back to Disneyland.

Summary: Pros: Across the street from Disneyland Resort, comfortable beds, Free hot breakfast (waffles, eggs, sausage, etc.), free parking (until 6pm check-out date), view of fireworks, pool & spa. Cons, Dated rooms, expensive rates, dated rooms, small rooms, boring lobby area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. I'm sorry you didn't like our rooms or lobby area.  We hope to update our rooms sometime next year  but the Lobby was just redone when we added our Breakfast and Fitness Room last year.  I hope you will give us another chance once we have remodeled.

Summary: The location can't be beat. We walked across the street to Disneyland.  The rooms were very small but we didn't spend much time there anyway.  If you have a car the parking lot was pretty small too.  The free breakfast was very good with many choices and outdoor seating. They "check you in" at breakfast by room number.  For the first time ever I witnessed an employee checking the temperature of the water baths under the food which impressed me.  There was a Denny's right next door for any other meals.  We used the outdoor pool and it was clean and perfect temperature.
Manager Response: It's all about the location, glad you were able to enjoy our breakfast as well! Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: Good location. Enjoy Disney until it close, and start from its opening. If got wet, able to go back to room. If got tired able to go back. Also, several restaurants locates next to the hotel, very convenient.
Manager Response: It's all about the location, so happy you enjoyed your stay!

Summary: This last stay was very enjoyable. I had four rooms for myself and family and the staff took care of all our needs. The breakfast provided was excellent and well presented. The location was great for our walk to the Disney parks. The beds was comfy. I will being staying with Best Western PLUS again.
Manager Response: Thank you for bring your family to stay with us.

Summary: Great room for my family, could have slept 3 more for a total of 8 if needed for under $300 across the street from Disney!  Having children with special needs sometimes I meet hospitality professionals who want to tell me rules, here they gave us a hand.  Breakfast has something for everyone.  Pool could be cooler, (Not their fault 100 degree day).
Manager Response: Thank you very much for staying with the Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn. We are pleased you found our staff helpful and enjoyed the breakfast. We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: Can not say enough about the location of this hotel.across the street from disneyland.probaly closer than disney hotels and not trapped by the commercialism. Hotel does the job,typically bestwestern plus.parking is a bit of a problem when it's busy. There's shopping in easy walking distance, fast food,convenience stores,restaurants.
Manager Response: Glad you liked our location, thanks for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Great Value and Close Walking Distance to Disneyland
Summary: In planning our first trip to Disneyland, we initially wanted to stay on the resort property.  However, it was difficult to justify the exorbitant prices (we traveled during July in the high season).  So, I started researching the Good Neighbor hotels.  It was important for me to find one with a gym and an included breakfast.  Easier said than done.  Thankfully, I found this hotel and was not disappointed.  It was so convenient to the entrance; I believe it's even closer than the Disneyland hotel itself.  We were able to quickly get back to the hotel and back to the park when we needed. The daily included hot breakfast saved us time and money, and I also enjoyed the new gym.  One night, we ate next door at Tony Roma's and were able to take leftovers back.  Our room included a
Manager Response: I glad you found us and that we were able to accommodate you.  I hope to see you on your next trip to the West Coast.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay for Disneyland
Summary: It is a very short walk to Disneyland and it is nice having the free Wi-Fi and breakfast included.  It is by no means a gourmet meal but sausage, toast, yogurt, donuts - will keep us full until lunch at the park.  The rooms are comfortable but dated with wall mounted air conditioning units.  The pool is small but with Disneyland across the street that is not a big deal to us.  We have passes so we have stayed here several times and once with other family members (4 adults and 4 kids in two rooms).  The staff is very helpful but parking can be difficult during busy times.  Although I think most of the hotels on Harbor Blvd have this problem.
Manager Response: Even though we guarantee one parking space for every guest room it can be a challenge, especially with the larger SUVs.  We hope you'll be back again soon.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a Disneyland visit
Summary: Very convenient location. A short walk to Disney entrance. Hotel was clean and comfortable. Staff was top notch; very friendly & helpful. Breakfast was better than I expected; nice selection of items and not just high carb options. Pool area is small but very well maintained. Nice variety of restaurants in the area.
Manager Response: It's always good to be better than expected.  Thanks for your feedback!

Summary: Close to Disneyland and restaurants. Comfortable rooms. Small pool, did not use during our stay though. Helpful staff, wide range of choices in the breakfast menu.  I loved the fact we could open the doors between our rooms and let the grand kids run around visiting everyone. We had 3 adjoining rooms
Manager Response: I'm glad you were able to put our connecting rooms to good use.  Bring the grand kids back to see us again soon.

Summary: Overall a very good experience...the location was perfect, an easy walk to the entrance of the park.  One of our four people had some health issues,  So it worked wonderfully for us to go to the park fairly early in the morning, take a mid-day break; and return to Disneyland the evening Indeed the parking was free, also the breakfast, and in-room wifi. We would stay here again on a trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: It does make it nice to be able to take a break mid day, I'm glad you were able to do that.  Thank you for your comments.

Summary: Great value and only a 4 minute walk to Disney!!!!  Breakfast items were a bit lacking but still an amazing value.  The rooms were very clean and the staff very helpful.  They have a laundry facility on the complex and the pool was very warm which was nice.  AMAZING VALUE!!!!
Manager Response: I'm glad you enjoyed your stay at the Anaheim Inn, thank you for staying with us.

Summary: Recently stayed at the Anaheim Inn on a trip to Disneyland.  It is definitely one of the most convenient places to Disneyland as it is right across the street, offers parking for guests staying at the hotel, and free breakfast.  On this stay, they actually had an issue with the room we were suppose to be staying at the first night, so had to move us to the other Best Western.  While this was inconvenient, they were very accommodating and helped us move our stuff back to the hotel for the final two nights.  Definitely recommend this place for those looking for an affordable place to stay while going to the Happiest Place on Earth.
Manager Response: I'd like to apologize for having to relocate you the first night.  I'm happy to hear that we were able to move you back without too much inconvenience and you were able to enjoy your time at Disney.  Thank you for understanding.

Summary Heading: So close to Disney, everything you need.
Summary: Excellent on all counts!! The hotel is close to Disney, you just walk across the road.  It is next to the iHop for breakfast, but a fridge and coffee making facilities is provided in each of the rooms. The room was clean, the bed was comfy, and the hotel has a pool.  The free parking was an excellent addition.  I would stay here again for sure.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words.  We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We always try to stay here whenever we are coming to the area for any of the theme parks in the area and even to the beaches. After a long day of running around it is always so nice to get back and just flop down in the comfort of the well appointed rooms and comfortable beds. The upgraded TVs are a plus as well. The entire staff are always so pleasant. Never had a negative experience in almost 10 years.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your loyalty!

Summary: As a DL pass holder we normally  stay at the Best Western Park Place for trips but unfortunately it was booked this time . Staff was very friendly . Lobby and breakfast room to this hotel very nice but our room was in need of a huge makeover .  We stayed on 3rd floor . Carpet and tile (grout)very dirty , air conditioning unit stuffed behind cabinet struggled to keep air circulating in room . The part we hated the most was the shower was VERY slow to drain and backed up ..gross .  However , did like that you can park car until 6pm on day of checkout , other hotel is 3pm . This hotel is very close to main gate also . Would prob stay again if they renovate in near future , otherwise I will stay at my trusty first choice two doors down .
Manager Response: Thank you for trying us when the Park Place was full.  We added our breakfast room this past year and hope to do our rooms in 2016.  We hope you'll try us again.

Summary: The hotel is in a great location - very close to Disneyland (5-10 minute walk to entrances). There are also many restaurants nearby (Denny's, IHOP, Tony Roma's, stone Cold Ice Cream). Free breakfast had lots of options, plenty of tables. Rooms were clean. Would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: See you on your next visit.

Summary: We recently returned from a 7 night stay at the Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn. We stayed in room 315 and 316. The hotel is located about 50 feet from the main security entrance  to both Disneyland and California Adventure. Pros: location, comfortable beds, free breakfast, Disneyland fireworks viewing, and FREE PARKING (many hotels along here charge upwards of $20 a day). Yes I said fireworks viewing... From room 301 you could see 80% of the show and hear the music! From our room, we could not see the ground stuff but could lay in bed and look out our window every night and watch the higher fireworks. Service from the staff was impeccable!! In one of our rooms the A/C started making a loud noise. The service staff was there in 3 minutes. The whole unit was changed out for a brand
Manager Response: It's nice to hear that you took advantage of our location to view the fireworks.  I never knew you could see them from inside the rooms in our front building!  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: Very attentive staff, nice affordable hotel for convenience to the Disney Parks. Highly recommend! Room was clean, check in and check out were hassle free, and the overnight staff took care of our needs (extra towels).
Manager Response: Thank you for your kinds words, I'll pass them on to my staff.

Summary: Best Western Plus is motel style accommodation. The hotel is approximately a 15 minute walk through a parking lot to Downtown Disney. This was ideal with the 2 day park hopper ticket as you could go back to the hotel during the day and return for fireworks/shows in the night. Utilities included free wi-fi, cable TV, pool and coin laundry. While not particularly trendy or modern, the room was good with a bathroom and kitchenette. You can get breakfast from the lobby including tea/coffee, muffins, breakfast bars, fruit and yoghurt.
Manager Response: It sounds like you may have stayed at our sister Best Western the Pavilions.  I will pass your comments on to them.

Summary: The hotel staff weren't very friendly and the carpets felt damp due to the humidity in the air.  Our room was supposed to be non smoking but it reaked of cigarette smoke.  We opened the windows to air it out but had to have maintenance come in to close them because they jammed.  Again, that was probably the humidity.  Outside of this the grounds were well maintained.  The pool was clean and the rooms were exceptionally cared for.  We would stay here in the future.
Manager Response: We have had our share of humidity this year, glad to hear it didn't dampen your stay.

Summary Heading: Perfect motel for your trip to Disneyland and California Adventure parks
Summary: Two things are great about this motel: Its close proximity to the main entrance to the Disney parks, and their hot breakfast.  The main entrance to the parks is within a very short walk from this motel; can't beat that. No need for any shuttles or any sort of transportation. We use Super Shuttle for our roundtrip transportation from and to the airport; a car is not needed if all you are doing is playing at Disney.  The motel's hot breakfast, which is included in your room charge already, is perfect for what is needed. We stayed at a different hotel in the past, which is on the same street, but their breakfast was just muffins and donuts - not that great. This motel has your eggs, sausages, potatoes, pancakes - you name it.  The rooms are clean, but if you want peace and quiet,
Manager Response: I'm happy to hear you found what you were looking for at the Anaheim Inn, glad you found us.

Summary Heading: Will come back to this location
Summary: This property was great, location is awesome and the room was good. Parking is a bit cramped, but it is free! They had a pretty nice breakfast layout with eggs, hashbrowns, and lots more. I enjoyed our stay, that have a computer kiosk in the lobby and allow you to print out your boarding passes for free - that's really nice. Overall this was a good place, and rates are really good for all that is included. I am actually going back to this location later this year. I recommend it.
Manager Response: Looking forward to seeing you next year!

Summary: very close to parks. acosss the street. you can even see fire works in the front of the hotel. only downfall is the noise levels from outside and above/below you. walls are very thin. otherwise great value.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we hope you'll stay with us again.

Summary: Everything is good about this hotel if you just need a good place to crash except the water.  It smells.  This is not unusual for any hotel on S. Harbor as I have stayed at several hotels on that road.  Wish they could do something about the smell of the water.  One of the best locations to go to Disneyland.  Closer than most of the Disney hotels.
Manager Response: I do know that we have very hard water in Anaheim.  I wish we could do something about it.

Summary: We stayed here 4 nights the week before the 4th of July.  My family loved it!   This motel is within about a 2 minute walk to the main entrance of Disneyland.  It's closer than the "on-property" Disney hotels. Although it is an older motel, it was very nicely decorated, clean, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The  complimentary breakfast was quite good, with lots of variety. It was also very nice that the offerings changed daily, so you had a little bit of variety on a multi day stay. The only complaint would be that the air conditioning didn't cool quite as well s it should and probably needed replaced, but it really wasn't a big problem.  Overall, we would stay here again in a heartbeat!
Manager Response: I's so happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed your Disney vacation.  Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: This hotel is a great location for going to Disneyland. It's located rite across the street. It's not a far walk. The hotel is very good to stay at. The rooms is not that spacious for a family of four. The beds is a double not a queen size. They have adjoining rooms if you request it though. The drainage in the bathtub is quite slow. They do offer a free breakfast (but no bacon). The fitness center was okay for me to do some workouts. Wanted to use the pool but didn't have the time since we were at Disneyland all day. They also offer free parking which was great. Some hotel charges extra for parking. They also charge a $5.00 resort fee per day. I guess if you use the amenities it's worth it. Many hotels charges resort fees these days but at least this hotel charges very minimal.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments, we hope you'll stay with us next time you're in Anaheim.

Summary: this is the second time here (last time 2007)  breakfast good location excellent especially for Disney thought the staff from the front desk to the cleaners were excellent bought my mum who is 76 and my step father who is 80 and they got a lovely ground floor room no parking charges at the hotel or Disney(5 minute walk
Manager Response: So glad you guys made it back to stay with us. Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Inn.

Summary Heading: Best place to say for Disneyland!
Summary: This hotel was a great stay for visiting Disneyland.  It was right across from the main entrance. It literally was walk out of Disneyland's main entrance, cross the street and go pass 3 buildings and you are there. We had not need to rent a car for that and that saves money right there. There are also places to eat right next to it. Denny's and IHOP. Both have kids eat free offers for dinner. The breakfast was good enough. Scrambled eggs, sausage or ham, potatoes, pancakes or waffles (toaster kind),  a variety of cereal and oatmeal, and pasties and donuts. It did lack good fresh fruit! Hotel was clean and staff was friendly and helpful. Room was fine and clean. Pool and spa seemed nice however we didn't use it. Would definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: Sounds like you had a great visit to Disney.  Thanks for staying with us, we hope to see you on your next trip.

Summary: If you are going to Disney this is a great place to stay. A very short walk to the main entrance with places to eat all around the hotel. The staff at the hotel is very helpful and try to do their best to help you enjoy yourself.
Manager Response: Location, location, location.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Closer to Disney than the Disney hotels
Summary: This hotel is literally across the street from Disneyland. You can wave at is as you take the monorail to Downtown Disney from Tomorrowland.  We have always stayed at Disney properties in Orlando...it makes sense there because of the distance to the parks, but this hotel was great. We were located in the back which was nice and quiet for us. The rooms are adequate. The free breakfast is so nice to keep the cost down. The rates were very cheap. We got $113 which was 1/3 of what the Disney hotels were charging.
Manager Response: I'm so glad you decided to stay with us,  I'm sure you put the money you saved to good use.

Summary: I have read many review that they were able to park early. Got there at 10 am and ask if we was able to park there early the front desk said no when the parking lot weren't even that full. Check in at 3pm and was surprise that all the room in the first building on the 3rd floor was gone. Room was okay, not the cleanest there was stain here and there. Breakfast was also okay nothing special and there was also a hair in the eggs. The staff member did a fast job at changing it though. I'd say the only thing great about this hotel is the location to Disneyland and it's cheap.
Manager Response: I'm sorry to read that your stay was not the one you had hoped for and that we weren't able to let you park prior to checking in at 3 pm. The availability of parking is based on the guests in house and what time they leave on their day of departure.  We always guarantee parking to our guest during their stay.

Summary Heading: Do you value a proper night's sleep?
Summary: You choose this motel for its proximity to Disneyland and for absolutely no other reason. It's a very convenient five minute walk from the entrance, which gives you the benefit of an early arrival at the park and unfettered access to the best rides before the hordes descend.  But do you value location over the ability to sleep well? The walls in this motel are paper thin. Every footstep in the rooms adjacent or above reverberate around your room. Excited children running up or down the stairs (which, by virtue of its proximity to Disneyland, happens regularly) will cause your room to vibrate with extreme ferocity. Should your neighbour dare to run a tap, or flush a toilet, or have a shower, you'll have the joy of sharing in the entire auditory experience. Needless to say,
Manager Response: Please accept my sincere apology to not meeting your expectations.

Summary: If you are on a budget this is the way to go you don't even have to take a bus just a short walk right to the gates. For my family this is a must we don't like being packed into a bus. The maids and the people at the desk were all nice and helpful, but what surprised me was the breakfast room was very spacious and a nice breakfast nothing fancy but good.
Manager Response: It is about the location, thanks for staying with us.

Summary: This was a perfect hotel for visiting Disneyland, literally across the street. We were able to park the day we arrived around 9:30am (as blessing would have it, we parked right in front of our room) and the next day until 6:00pm. This is a huge saving in parking and saves the walk from the official Disney parking lot. Our room was clean and quiet. The breakfast was substantial enough to hold us most of the day. Never before stayed overnight when visiting Disneyland but this was just too convenient not to stay.
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed your first overnight in Anaheim.

Summary: The location can't be beat! But this review is really about the hotel and rooms itself - we used the rooms perhaps more than the regular DL visitor staying here would have, because we had 3 kids under 3 yrs with us, and one of them got sick. We were pleasantly surprised at the size of the rooms and the cleanliness of the beds and esp. bathrooms. It was perfect for our needs. And because we had to get the kids back early for bedtime in the evenings,it was really great to be able to sit on the bed and look out the large windows to see the fireworks :-) Was also impressed with the included breakfast offerings - scrambled eggs, hardboiled eggs, bacon, bagels, toast, yogurt cups, oatmeal, cereals, various jellies and even nutella cups, and of course fresh fruit. Great to get us going
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your recommendation of Fasai Thai, we are always looking for new restaurants  to recommend to our guests.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: I'd like to give this hotel a 1-star, because I'd hate to see a "no vacancy" sign next time I want to stay there; but that wouldn't be fair to the hotel or prospective guests. This is such a nice place. It is a bit "older" property, but everything is clean and nicely maintained. It is family-friendly, and an easy walk across Harbor Blvd to the Disneyland Resort. Staff members are friendly and efficient. Beds are comfortable. Parking lot is a little cramped, but a nice perk. It's the only hotel we consider when going to Disneyland for multiple days.
Manager Response: Thanks for not giving us a one star rating, I like the one you gave us better!  See you on your next visit to the Resort.

Summary: Location location location!!!  Directly across the road from the Disneyland entrance. This was incredibly handy for ducking back late in the day for jackets etc.   Hotel was very basic however it was clean, comfortable and provided a free breakfast. This was especially good prior to big days at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Glad you liked our location, thanks for staying with us.

Summary: I was really quite happy staying here. The location could not have been better with less than a five minute walk from the Disneyland gates. The room was large and comfortable with a televisions, mini fridge, coffee maker and even a microwave. Continental breakfast was included, which was pretty good and saved a lot compared to the parks. All this for what I consider to be a very reasonable price. This is where I will stay in future visits to DL without a doubt.
Manager Response: We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: We scheduled our trip to Disneyland months in advance, and spent some time researching rooms.  A close friend referred Best Western Plus, and advised me that she and her family had stayed there a few times.  The overall rating is EXCELLENT.  The hotel was clean, the rooms were clean, the staff was wonderful.  We ate the on-site breakfast every morning and were pleasantly surprised!  They offered a wide range of food...much more than a traditional continental breakfast!  We had a very relaxing stay!  We stayed three nights and were able to walk across the street to visit Disneyland, and back to our hotel for breaks/naps.  We had a 2 year old with us, and she was comfortable as well.  Great fun....and the Best Western made it so much easier on us all.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words.  I'm glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: Great stay close to knotts berry farm and a short distance walk from Disneyland. Went to Disneyland for a week didnt have to move the car.  Price is worth the stay. Very clean. Staff very friendly. Denny's & Mcdonald's are close by as well. Would definitely recommend this to everyone.
Manager Response: Thank you for recommending us to your friends.

Summary Heading: Excellent BW PLUS Anaheim Inn, Anaheim
Summary: We visited Disneyland, and decided to stay at this hotel.  Check in was easy, the room was exceptional, and the beds were comfortable.  The free hot breakfast was fantastic on both days.  No cost for parking either.  We will stay at this hotel when returning to Disneyland, will also recommend this hotel to family, and friends.
Manager Response: Thank you for deciding to stay with us, we look forward to future visits.

Summary Heading: Great hotel in a great location!
Summary: This hotel is perfect for a Disney getaway. The walk to Disneyland is 5 minutes at the most, and the rooms are comfy and clean. The breakfast was tasty with plenty of seating and a fun balcony seating area overlooking the park. All of the staff were extremely friendly and parking was free! I would recommend this hotel for sure!
Manager Response: I'm happy to hear you made use of our balcony off the breakfast room, it's my favorite place to have breakfast.

Summary Heading: Just Stayed and Will Be Returning
Summary: Across street from Disney Park, (convenient), Friendly, helpful staff, decent breakfast with hot/cold food, clean and well maintained rooms, and cost friendly- the best deal around for your money's worth. I have a toddler and I was able to have her fed w hot food every am, return for regular naps every day and every staff interaction was friendly, or at worst, not unfriendly. We had a great stay. This is now our go-to Disney hotel because I know I will get what we need, have decent pleasant stay and its affordable.
Manager Response: Being so close to the Resort is important when you have little ones, so glad you found us.

Summary: Was really a nice hotel!  Rooms are nice and comfortable and very close to the Disneyland maingate!  Free wifi is a plus and it is centrally located for ease around the Disneyland area.  I recommend this to anyone!
Manager Response: Thank you for recommending us, we sure appreciated it.

Summary: Great location was the main reason we selected this hotel to stay.  We took my 2 years old to Disneyland for this trip and she needs to take a nap during the day. So it's perfect that it's just right across the street from the main gate so we can go back to hotel to let her take a nap comfortablly then go back to play later. The service and the cleanliness are always good to be expected from Best Western.
Manager Response: It does make it easier to come back during the day for a nap for both little and big kids.  Sometimes the adults need it more!

Summary: The hotel staff was friendly, made check in and check out a breeze.  Breakfast was a plus, next to so many choices to eat at also within walking distance.  I would stay there again and again!  This hotel was the closet I have ever stayed to Disneyland Resort, I appreciated the close walk back to our room for an afternoon break.  Being next door to Denny's was also a major plus that I was not aware of until our arrival.  You also receive a discount at Denny's if you present your hotel card key when you pay for your meals.  We enjoyed our overall stay and would recommend this hotel to friends, family and co-workers.
Manager Response: I have to agree with you, being so close to the Park is great.  Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: Great location.  Adequate facility.  Bookkeeping and reservation issues, but they got resolved.  Pool area not resort wonderful, but pool was clean.  Paper, not ceramic cups, for coffee.  Food for the breakfast menu was sufficient.  The staff was helpful and friendly.  The rooms could use some updating, but they appeared clean.  When I had the over charge for the stay, the hotel manager was helpful and the issue was resolved within the day.  When reserving the multiple rooms, the reservation staff had problems with the varied arrival times and dates.  The rooms are cramped, but sufficient for the need.  Double beds only, so sleeping was cramped for adults.  Mostly, though, it was a satisfactory stay and the staff did the best they could for our group.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing the Anaheim Inn to accommodate your family on your recent trip to Disneyland.  I apologize for any confusion regarding your accounts but am happy I was able to clear them up before you left.

Summary: I stumbled upon the BW Plus Anaheim Inn a year and a half ago. I love it!  The staff is ALWAYS friendly and accomodating. Room requests have always been honored (I prefer bottom level up from room).  The free breakfast is one of the best you will find  at this level of hotel.  It is not made to order, but includes multiple hot items and is always well stocked with a large assortment of other items.  The standard rooms are spacious with very comfortable beds.  I've stayed there three times now and have never had any room problems. The hotel is about one minute away from the crosswalk to Disneyland Resort, so it's a very quick walk back after a long day at the parks. I have pretty consistently paid about $115-$130/night for a 2Q room.
Manager Response: I'm so glad you found us and keep returning, thank you!

Summary: doesn't look like much from the outside but the rooms are very cozy and nice on the inside. we had a problem with our outlet in the room but the hotel staff happily put us in a different room close by. great service
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear you had outlet problems but glad to here we were able to move you to another room so that we could fix it.

Summary: Arrived a little after 3pm, room was ready to check in.  We were given a room right next to the elevator, which worried me a bit - but it was a total non issue the whole time we were there.  With the exception of a few very excited kids from another room on our last day there - it was very peaceful and quiet.  The room itself was very spacious and clean.  A mini fridge and microwave were provided which was nice, as some of the other places to stay in the area don't provide or charge extra for them.  We only did the breakfast once, however the day we went it was very good - plenty of both hot and cold choices with plenty of space to sit and enjoy your meal.  The front service desk was one of the best, most courteous that we have come across.   If you are looking for a great place
Manager Response: How nice to hear that the only issue you had was a few excited kids from next door.  It's hard not to be excited when you're across the street from Disneyland.  Hope to see you on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: I have stayed at this location before and it just keeps getting better. The new breakfast room is outstanding with a variety of items to choose from, and who can beat the fact this location is just a few steps away from the entrance to Disneyland.
Manager Response: The breakfast room is now a year old, but it sounds like this is your first trip back since it opened.  I'm so glad you like it!

Summary Heading: 1 King & 2 Queen beds in 1 room-perfect for families!
Summary: Loved the 3 beds in one room deal!  Service was great and the housekeeper gave us exactly what we asked for. Front desk called daily to make sure we were satisfied with everything. If you can, ask for a room in the first building closer to the lobby. Free hot breakfast is in the 1st building on the 2nd floor. Rooms in the 1st building on the 2nd or 3rd floors & closest to the lobby offers best views of the fireworks at Disneyland. We had a room in the 2nd building and still could see some of the fireworks. Also, this place is just a few minutes of a walk to Disneyland. Perfect if you need a nap/break during your visit to the Park!
Manager Response: It sounds like you were in one of our Family Suites, glad to hear you enjoyed it.

Summary Heading: Convenient, but plan ahead for parking
Summary: This hotel is extremely close to the Disneyland park entrance, less than a 10 min walk.  Great for taking a nap during the day or dropping off shopping bags. The parking situation is confusing, as guests that are checked out, may leave their cars in the hotel lot until 6pm.  That means, guests checking in, do not have a guaranteed spot until after they check in (3pm or maybe even later). If you planned to arrive early, and use the hotel parking the morning of your check-in date, you're out of luck.  Head straight to the Disney parking lot, and save yourself some time and frustration trying to negotiate parking with the front desk.  You can move your car later in the afternoon/evening.   The general Best Western reservation number confirmed parking in the hotel lot, but this is
Manager Response: Parking is guaranteed  to our guests at check in time, 3pm.  If parking is available before that time we are happy to let you park but it's not guaranteed.  I apologize for any misunderstanding.

Summary: This is the second time in 6 months and it was once again a great experience. the Best Western is clean, comfortable, and walking distance to Disneyland. Extra towels arrived promptly and mgmt allowed 2 extra guests (friends of ours that we rescued from a horrible hotel in Santa Ana) to stay in our room very last minute and free of charge. Pool area has bushes shaved into characters (did not notice this last time) and continental breakfast is hearty and fresh. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the Anaheim area, and I will most certainly be returning!
