Manager Response: I'm happy to hear you enjoyed your stay, but at the same time sorry to know that you missed the elevator and had to drag your luggage up the stairs.  I'll be sure we point them out in future.

Summary: This is my hotel of choice!   Everyone is always very nice, the rooms are clean, the wifi works, the free breakfast is good, and location is excellent.  After being in the park ALL day we get back to the room and there's peace and quite.  Plus the beds are soooo comfy.  I've never had an issue in this hotel.  This hotel is literally right across the street from Disneyland' s main entrance and with kids this place is ideal.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your continued loyalty!

Summary Heading: Great hotel, not very pleasent staff
Summary: The hotel was a great location for our trip to Disneyland, the rooms were very clean and the beds were SUPER comfy! the staff was very stand-offish and not helpful at all. They were pretty rude. That was the only thing I had an issue with. Other than that, everything else was great!
Manager Response: I'm so happy that you liked the Hotel, but embarrassed to hear that you thought our staff was standoffish and  not helpful.  Please accept my apologies.  Thank  you for your candid comments and know that they have been shared with all so that will not happen to any other guest.  I do hope that you will consider staying with us again.

Summary: My daughter and I really loved our stay at this hotel apart from freezing every time the air conditioner kicked in. It sent a blast of icy air into the room and rattled really loudly. There was no way to regulate the temperature so we just wore our warm clothes. The rooms were huge, clean, with very comfortable beds. We could watch the high fireworks from our balcony and walk to and from Disneyland easily. It was great to have a fridge and microwave to prepare our own meals. The breakfast room was being renovated so we were given a small bottle of water, apple, mini-muffin, and sweet muesli bar. Tip: Keep the bottle from the water to refill at the free water stations in Disneyland.
Manager Response: Sorry to hear you had problems with your air conditioner.  If we had known we would have fixed it so you wouldn't have had to pull out your warm clothes.  Hope to see you and your daughter next time you're in the States.

Summary: Front desk staff outstanding. Met my request for downstairs room. Room was very good except pillows were very big and hard.  In process of remodeling breakfast area. Would like to have had coffee in lobby as I get up before rest of family. Will return if in area again.
Manager Response: Thanks you, we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: My family took our first trip to Disneyland and we decided to stay at the Best Western Plus Anaheim inn and boy am I glad we did. First and foremost the location is amazing. We literally only had a five minute walk from our room to Disneyland entrance. The front desk clerks were so helpful and I felt they really went above and beyond for us. Our room was clean and the brown bag breakfast was perfect to hold is over till lunch. We are panning another vacation next summer and will stay here again. Thanks Best Western for adding to our magical vacation.
Manager Response: Please give me a call when you're ready to make your reservations for next summer.

Summary: We stayed here over the weekend for our Disney getaway for 2 nights.  One room was for me and my hubby and 2 kids.  Another room was for 3 of my friends.  Loved it that our rooms were connecting.    The location is great.  it is right across the street from Disneyland.  It is probably a 10 minute walk from hotel room to the disney resorts.  the hotel is next to Dennys and Tony Romas.  There is also Ihop and Cold Stone close by.  The room is small but thats fine.  since we are there only at night for sleep.  We checked in early around 2pm.  they do not have a hot breakfast but they do have a brown bag breakfast which consists of granola bar, apple, muffin, and water.  it is great to pick up right before you go to the park.  But I suggest getting the bags before 9am.  They do have
Manager Response: I'm so glad we were able to get you and your family into connecting rooms.  With kids it makes the experience more fun.  Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: This hotel was a perfect location from Disneyland with great service from the staff.  The room was clean and well appointed in great working order, microwave,fridge and coffee maker. There were restaurants just steps from the hotel and everything Disney was in short walking distance.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review, I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: We have stayed here 3 summers in a row.  Love the location friendly helpful staff.  Rooms are tired but kept very clean.  The pool and hot tub was great for when we were tired from the parks.  The rooms face the right way so you could watch the fireworks from the hotel.  Recommend room on 3rd floor. I would absolutely recommend this hotel.  I can't wait to go back next year!
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your loyality!  We all look forward to seeing you next year when our Breakfast Room is complete.

Summary: We stayed at the Best Western Anaheim Inn while on a mini vacation trip. It was just perfect!  Coming back to the hotel after a long day at the Parks felt so nice due to the great service, immaculate rooms, and exquisite staff - not to mention the pool!!  The Best Western Anaheim Inn is a perfect destination while on Leisure, business, or a special trip, such as a honeymoon, or wedding anniversaries!  Stayed July 2013, traveled on Leisure
Manager Response: Nothing is better than a Mini Vacation, thank you for spending yours'  with us!

Summary: We drove up and were so happy to see that it was two doors down from the entrance to Disneyland!! Check in was problem free. We were also glad to see that parking was free. We got to our room and first noticed that it was pretty small/crowded. I didn't really like that the bathroom sink and vanity was in the room versus in the bathroom. It was annoying to my family that I had to dry my hair in the same room they were sleeping in. But, the room was very clean. We were at the far top end of the hotel so we found it to be very quiet. Because the hotel was in the process of making a breakfast area they had no warm breakfast, but the did have a brown bag breakfast. It included a muffin, granola bar, apple and a small water bottle. When we had to use their computer to print out our
Manager Response: I understand what you said about the bathroom, but we have found that by having the vanity area outside the actual bathroom, more people are able to get ready at the same time.  Our Breakfast and Fitness Rooms will be completed in March 2014, I hope you'll be back to visit.

Summary Heading: Hop, Skip & a Jump to Disneyland
Summary: We choose this hotel as it was almost directly across the street from Disneyland, Ahaheim.  We were really pleased with the staff and their willingness to accommodate us weary travelers.  Rooms were nice and clean.  Overall, it was a good experience and have already booked another stay in October.  Felt prices were reasonable for the convenience of being close to the park...important when there are young children who simply can't walk another step!
Manager Response: I'm so glad to hear you enjoyed your recent stay and will be returning in October.  While we will be under construction (adding our Breakfast Room) you will enjoy the same level of service.  See you in October!

Summary Heading: Great for a hotel close to Disney!
Summary: I stayed at the hotel for about 4 nights in June while I was visiting Disneyland.  This hotel is brilliant for that purpose it is pretty much the closest hotel to the park entrance that is not an actual Disney hotel. For the price alone, the location is worth it! There are also a couple of cheap family restaurants and convenience stores within walking distance.  Staff were nice and friendly and helped us organise a tour around Los Angeles on one of the days.   One disappointment was the fact that there wasn't a breakfast area. Instead we were given a paper bag with an apple, muffin, granola bar and small bottle of water. This was sufficient however when you are going for a full day at Disneyland you want something substantial.  We had a room with two queen beds and for two
Manager Response: We understand the need for breakfast, before spending the day at Disneyland, and that is why we start construction on our Breakfast and Fitness Rooms on September 3rd.  I hope you'll be able to enjoy it on your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Really nice Hotel to stay at in the Disneyland Area!
Summary: I came to this hotel for my birthday in November and it was worth every penny for this place, walking to and from the park was okay. We checked in and the staff let us keep our luggage in the lobby for one of two things, one our room wasn't ready and we wanted to get going to Disneyland which was nice of them to do. Room and view was beautiful because we got to watch the fireworks from the balcony and we had 3 beds one in the front room and one in the back room. It was a birthday to remember for a long time!
Manager Response: I'm glad we were able to make your 2012 birthday special.  Will you be joining us again for birthday this year?

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 5 night in June of 2013 and we were impressed with this hotel.  This was my 3rd trip to Disneyland and I have previously stayed at the HOJO and the BW Stovall's Inn but after staying at the Anaheim Inn next time I go to Disneyland this will be my first choice.    We choose this hotel because of the location and the price, a lot cheaper than staying in a Disney hotel!  We checked in at around noon, our room wasn't ready but we were allowed to park and the desk attendant was friendly (this was not the case when we had stayed at the Stovall's Inn).  She even gave us a key so we could access the pool area & bathrooms since the room wasn't ready.  So we headed to the parks and timed ourselves and it took us about 5 minutes to get to the turnstiles
Manager Response: I remember answering your survey and checking to see why your door was left open.  We had painted some doors that day and wanted to be sure they were dry before closing them.  I'm so sorry it alarmed you, you should have been warned at check in.  Happy to hear everything else worked out for you, hope to see you on your next trip to Disneyland.

Summary: This place was the right price and 5 minutes from the park, literally across the street from the entrance of Disney. Free parking. The room was comfortable, clean. There was a fridge and microwave in the room which proved to be helpful. Service at the front desk was great. And as they are working on the breakfast room, they did provide a brown paper bag breakfast. Overall, we couldn't have been happier with the choice since our #1 priority was location from Disney. It was also walking distance to an outdoor mall and a ton of restaurants. Thank you!
Manager Response: You're welcome, thanks so much for staying with us!

Summary Heading: Fantastic choice for a Disney visit!
Summary: I would ABSOLUTELY recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Disneyland.  You can't beat the location...literally a 5 minute walk to the front gates of Disneyland or California Adventure or Downtown Disney.  There are restaurants right next door (Tony Roma's on one side and Denny's on the other) with others an easy walk down Harbor Blvd.  Only two other hotels are as close to Disney as this.  Enough about the location though...the room was spacious and clean and very comfortable.  The staff was exceptionally friendly.  They are building a breakfast room to open in 2014 but in the meantime they provide each guest with a brown-bag breakfast with bottled water, granola bar, apple and a muffin.  I can't say enough good things about this hotel.  It's a great choice.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words, I'm so glad you enjoyed your recent stay.  We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is across the street from Disneyland, you can get to your room faster than getting to your car in the Disney parking lot.  The hotel is clean and in good shape with a great staff.  They do not have a breakfast room yet ready in 2014 but they provide a snack bag with an apple a muffin and a desert bar which will tide you over till lunch.  There are several places to eat very close by also.  Overall it is a great place to stay to visit Disney.
Manager Response: You are correct, it's closer to leave your car parked here than to park it at one of the Disney lots.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: Perfect location for a visit to Disneyland.  Only a 7 min walk to the entrance to both parks.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was good value for money.  I could see the fireworks clearly from the 2nd floor stairs.  Staff were friendly and helpful and you can purchase your disneyland tickets here.  Plenty of restaurants nearby and I can highly recommend Mimis.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments, nice to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.  I have to agree, Mimi's is a great restaurant!

Summary Heading: Very enjoyable and pleasant accommodations with friendly staff!!!
Summary: Our stay at the Best Western turned out to be an unexpected bonus to our visit to Disneyland. We disk a preliminary check in at 830 am and found out that not only we could leave our vehicle for the day but were only a 7 minute walk from the Disneyland gate which is probably a closer walk than from the Disneyland parking lot. Furthermore, we found the hotel staff to be extremely pleasant and accommodating from Juan to the ladies at the front desk. Also the room accommodated our 7 party family very well and represented good value. Thank you for a great memory!!! Jerry and Irene Facey -Saipan, Northern Mariana Islands
Manager Response: Happy to hear that the suite worked so well for you and your family, wish you could have stayed longer.  Hope you'll stay with us next time you visit Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good location, comfortable rooms, tight parking
Summary: A number of hotels line Harbor Boulevard across from Disney, including two or three BWs.  We chose BW Plus Anaheim Inn based on previous reviews, price, and being within a half a block of Disney.  We were not disappointed.  The room was comfortable and clean, and given its location, the price (around $150) was not out of line.  The pool is small, but we didn't use it.  The WiFi, even for us in the very last room at the back of property worked well.  The hotel does not have a breakfast as they are in the process of building a breakfast room, but they did offer snack bag each morning.  Staff was friendly and helpful.    Only three drawbacks - parking is rather tight, our sink was slow and needed some work (though it did not directly inconvenience us), and sounds from other guests
Manager Response: It is truly location, location, location.  I am sorry to hear that your sink was a little slow, had we known, it would have been happy to take care of it.

Summary: It's hard to beat this place's location: RIGHT across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  While they're building a breakfast room, this hotel offers prepackaged breakfast bags that contain a small muffin (banana, blueberry or chocolate) and Quaker granola bar, a small red delicious apple and a small water. I was down in the lobby at 5 minutes to 7 am so I would buy tickets and stand in line at California Adventure and the man at the lobby said I had to wait the 5 minutes. I thought that was kind of ridiculous so I just went on my way.  Clean rooms, very tight parking. The pool and hot tub were perfect for ending a long day.
Manager Response: We always have the Disney Multi Day Park Hopper Tickets available for our Guests to purchase.  I have no answer as to why he would ask you to wait until 7 to purchase them, please accept my sincere apology.  I'm glad to hear that everything else worked for you.

Summary: We spent 1 night here to visit Disneyland and were impressed by the friendliness of the reception staff, the cleanliness of the room with the proximity to the park being a bonus.  Upon check-out we were able to leave our luggage with reception and  the car in the car park [free of charge] and just walked across the road and into the fanasy world - awesome.  We'd definitely stay here again and only can recommend this place
Manager Response: I'm sorry you weren't able to spend more time with us at the Anaheim Inn.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: Great location for Disneyland access directly across from main entrance. Restaurants and shops also nearby. Friendly helpful staff with lots of info available on surrounding area. Breakfast prepacked bags available which were handy for leaving early and taking to Disneyland included a muffin, muesli bar, fresh apple and small water bottle. Easy Parking access, free wifi, fridge and microwave in the room. Stayed for 5 days and no problems at all.
Manager Response: I so glad to hear that you and your friends enjoyed your stay in Anaheim.  We really do have everything close by.  Hope to see you on your next trip to the States.

Summary: We have stayed at this motel several times and really enjoy it, but as of last year and this year I have had issues with it. Last year after waiting until check-in time which is 3:00PM I was given the card key to the room and was told it was ready. Upon entering the room we found that it had never been cleaned from the last guest. The beds were not made up, the bathroom was very dirty and there was trash all over the room. I went to the office, told them of the situation and was given a room that was cleaned and ready for occupancy. That was last year. This year almost the same thing happened. I was given the card key and told the room was ready. Upon arriving at the room we found that the maid was still in the process of cleaning it. This was well after the check in time. The
Manager Response: I'd like to apologize and thank you at the same time.  My sincere apology for the issues you experienced both this time, and the time before.  I'd also like to thank you for letting us know so that we can see that it doesn't happen to anyone again.  If you decide to return to the Anheim Inn, I'd like to personally make your reservationa and be able to apologize in person.

Summary Heading: Location, location, location....but everything else is average
Summary: First and foremost you cannot possibly get a hotel with a better location. Unless you pay 4x as much and stay in a Disney hotel. It is perfect if you want to run back and forth from the park to take nap, go for a swim, change your clothes, etc. The room itself is rather ho hum. Clean but  a bit dated. Small but not necessarily  cramped. The pool is tiny and crowded but useable. If you book directly through bestwestern.com you will get the best rate which can be affordable in the off season. The staff is friendly.  Overall: The Good- LOCATION! Price if you book in the off season, friendly staff. The Bad- Room and resort are just a place to sleep...that's about it. No breakfast. The Ugly-  None that I can think of.
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid review, I'm glad the Anaheim Inn worked out for you.  I hope you'll try us again when we start serving breakfast in early 2014.

Summary Heading: Perfect for a trip to Disneyland!
Summary: The hotel is in walking distance to Disneyland, California Adventure, Downtown Disney and lots of places to eat!  It's less than 5 minutes to the Disneyland entrance!  It's an older hotel, no frills but it's very, very clean and the staff was much nicer than some of the more expensive hotels we stayed in. There is a fridge and a microwave in the room which was a plus. We would stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our staff, I will pass them on.  Hope to see you next time you're in Anaheim.

Summary: This property gives you the premier location to make you Disney experience complete. Your are smack right in the middle of all the action. Great restaurants, convenience stores and the great parking! Can't be beat!
Manager Response: I couldn't have said it better, so glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: You could do a lot worse for a visit to Disneyland.  This property is right across the street from its welcome plaza so it is about a five minute walk to the front gates.  There are also other great things about this hotel.  I was worried that I would find years of cotton candy stains but the room was very clean and comfortable.  In fact the whole property was clean and well-maintained.  We stayed on the top level so noise was not a problem.  We stopped by a local Target for breakfast foods and snacks but did use the bag breakfast for snacks in the park.  The fruit was good, the small bottle of water fit perfectly in our bags.  The muffin could have better.  I would definitely stay here again will I visit Disneyland
Manager Response: It sounds like you put our "Breakfast Snack Bags" to good use.  They do come in handy during the day at the Parks.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: This location was perfect especially for my grandkids.  We would come back for naps in the afternoon and then be able to walk to Disneyland or Downtown Disney quickly.  Although this is not a 5 star hotel, it is clean and perfect location.  Would love a breakfast room -- which apparently is scheduled for next year.
Manager Response: We look forward to seeing you and your grandkids again, after the Breakfast Room is complete in early 2014!

Summary: I have no complaints about this property.  The beds were great, towels were big and fluffy, the location is hard to beat.  Room cleaning service exceeded all my expectations.  We always came back from Disneyland to a clean, quiet room.  We were in the middle of the structure and never heard noise from above or any surrounding rooms.  As AP holders, we will be back to Anaheim in Sept, Oct, and Nov.  Much to my dismay, I had to book elsewhere to get competitive rates.  It is my hope to return depending upon room prices.
Manager Response: I so glad to hear that we exceeded your expectations.  As an Annual Pass holder, I hope we will see you again.

Summary: Clean, convenient and family friendly.  Just a hop-skip-and a jump away from the park, making a mid-day break easy to accomplish (keeping everyone happy).  The staff is great, and love the morning breakfast to go bags!
Manager Response: Let me know the next time you want to come to your Disney "Home", we'll have your room waiting.  Glad you like it!

Summary Heading: Location was the reason we booked here
Summary: This was my fourth time at Disney, and I've stayed at a different place every time.  This was definitely the best for location!  We were able to come back during the day, or drop our bags after shopping in Downtown Disney and then go back for the fireworks.  We didn't mind leaving the parks for a while because the hotel was so close.    Other than the location, it was a typical motel.  The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and the room had a microwave and fridge, which really came in handy. There was nothing fancy about the room, but it was clean and comfy. The room was cleaned daily, and although we hung our towels, they replaced them anyways.  One thing I really appreciated is that the cleaning staff seemed to notice that we only used the regular coffee, and not the
Manager Response: Because we have a few regular guests that want a smoking room, we still have a few available.  I'm glad you were able to reserve one.  On your next visit you'll be able to enjoy Disneyland's fireworks from our Breakfast Room, opening in early 2014.  Hope to see you soon.

Summary: Now if you are looking for a 5* hotel this is not it.  It is 2.5-3 depending on what site you look at and that is what you get.  The main point is that you are in easy walking distance(5 min) to main gates and rooms are clean and beds are comfortable and staff goes over and above to help.  We stayed in a suite with 3 double beds in 2 rooms.  We where in the first building 3rd floor at the end of the hall looking over the pool.  We did not notice any noise.  We stayed 3 nights.  Each day we where up early and the first day room was cleaned before we got back for afternoon rest, second day it was not.  I went to the front desk and as if they could clean when we walked to store and it was taken care of very quickly.  Service was A+.  My husband lost his phone and thought he left it
Manager Response: While we don't claim to to be a five star property, we have a five star location and try to give five star service.  I'm so glad to hear our staff lived up to your expectations.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: Location to Disneyland Pedestrian Entrance is a No Brainer!
Summary: Location & Cleanliness & Value for the Room including a daily complimentary hot meal continental breakfast open until 10am exceeded my expectations!  Was able to leave my bags in the Lobby until Shuttle pick up & staff readily allowed a little later checkout! Outstanding Reservations & Front Desk Customer Service! Would stay at BWPPI again as long as the room rates remain a value and the rooms/grounds are maintained! 24 hr Security also a very good thing!
Manager Response: Although the Best Western Anaheim Inn is close to Disneyland's pedestrain entrance, I believe you stayed at the Best Western Park Place Inn.  We are part of a group of four Best Western properties here in Anaheim and will will pass your kind words on to them.

Summary: After standing in lines st Disneyland, I did not want to wait for a shuttle. This hotel is right across the street from the main gate. It is clean and quiet. We watched the fireworks every night from our hotel window. They also provide a sack of snacks to take into the park.
Manager Response: I'm so glad you enjoyed our great location, thanks for staying with us.

Summary: The best western anaheim inn was a little below average in my opinion, but the room was not terrible. We stayed there in April. Just be sure that you confirm the amount of rooms you have reserved before your visit. They charged us a cancellation fee of $220 because they mistakenly reserved 5 rooms for our family instead of 3. I don't know how it happened but it was some kind of error in their computer system. They weren't willing to listen to us when we explained to them that we only reserved 3 rooms. (through priceline) I filed a complaint with the BBB but the hotel  did not respond to it. Make reservations here at your own risk.
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you had problems with your reservations in April. I do know that we have a 48 hour cancel policy but can not speak for Priceline.  If you would supply me with more informantion, I'd be happy to look into what happened. You also mentioned that you contacted the BBB, but we were never contacted by them.  I look forward to hearing from you.

Summary: I was hesitant to stay here, but read reviews and decided to try it. It turned out to be a good stay. Location is great...right across the street from Disneyland. Daily snack bag was good (hotel will soon have a breakfast), free parking and vending machines for snacks and drinks (cheaper than buying at the parks). I would stay again if not on Disney property.
Manager Response: Thank you for deciding to stay at the Anaheim Inn.  We hope to see you next time you're on the mainland.

Summary: I loved this motel, it is perfectly located to visit Disneyland. Whilst not having in room services Dennys is just next door which is a much cheaper option than most overpriced international hotels. The rooms are very clean. They offer excellent facilities like a microwave and fridge if you were staying for longer.  There is a pool. Drinks machines and the staff are fantastic.  I am so glad we didn't pay for an international hotel because it would have simply been a waste of money. I highly reccommend this property to anybody. If I ever make it back to Disneyland we will be staying here again.  I have stayed in top 5 star hotels across the world and worked in a four star and this hotel has as much to offer as they did just without all the extra class. Great !
Manager Response: Wow, what a great review, thank you!  I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: We stayed over the Memorial weekend and enjoyed our stay. The rooms were clean (just a little dated, but that's ok), had a little fridge and microwave in the room which is nice if you have kids and need that. It's located in between a Denny's and Tony Roma's which makes it nice. The staff was pleasant. Parking is the only complaint. It's very limited. You are only allowed one car per room on the premises. So if you're traveling with another couple and sharing a room you should call the hotel ahead of time to find out what needs to be done if you have two vehicles. The nice thing is this Best Western does not charge for daily parking like the other just 2 minutes away. We would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Parking is tight so we have to limit one car per room but our Staff will always help find additional parking in the area.  I'm sorry if this was a problem for you.

Summary: This hotel was ok for an older hotel.  The rooms were adequate, ours was right beside the pool on the second floor.  There was some dirt on the window sill in the bathroom so hadn't been cleaned in quite some time but it is high up.  The cost is reasonable for what you get and the beds were quite comfortable but we did not spend alot of time in the room.  We had a microwave, fridge and coffee maker in the room.  There is a small pool there and a hot tub which we used to cool off after a morning at Disneyland.  it is in a convenient spot, right accross from Disneyland with many restaurants very close by so you don't need to pay Disneyland prices for food.  The hotel does supply a small brown bag every morning which has water, granola bar and some other kind of treat such as a
Manager Response: I'd like to apologize for any cleanliness issues,  I have brought it to the attention of my Housekeeping staff and trust it will not happen again.  Glad to hear you enjoyed the our location and our "snacks'.

Summary: Being a die hard stay on site disney junkie in florida (deluxe hotels), i refused to pay the amounts they required in Disney california. After reading the reviews of this place, i thought id give it a go, and IF it was awful i was only there for a couple of days. The room was spacious and very clean(one thing i hate is a dirty room or sheets!), equiped with coffee maker and coffee/creamer etc. bathroom was clean and smelling fresh.two queen beds, table and chairs, plus TV and drawer unit. Also a wardrobe which housed an iron and ironing board, plus a space to hang clothes. Thie place is SO close to disney you could alsmost touch it, out of the hotel grounds turn right and cross the road, approx 3 minutes, ideally located for the disney parks. The hotel offer a brown breakfast
Manager Response: We call it our "Brown Bag Breakfast Snack" but I'm happy to hear it worked for you all day.  I do hope you'll be back to see us next year when our Breakfast Room ic complete.

Summary: Best western is affiliated with airmiles so that was a bonus. It is right across from the main entrance to Disney. The Denny's restaurant is next door and has reasonable fare for all meals. We did have a change to use the pool and hot tub too which was good. The 2nd floor (motel style)  Hs an elevator which was great and they also stored our luggage until checking. The service staff were helpful and always there to answer questions. Our unit had a microwave and coffee maker too. Definitely would book in here again
Manager Response: It's always a plus to be able to use your airmiles for pleasure. I am so happy you picked the Anaheim Inn, thank you.

Summary Heading: Basic but clean hotel, very close to Disney.
Summary: The rooms are a bit old fashioned although very clean and handy for Disneyland. Disney parks are about a 2 minute walk which is ideal as we could pop back mid-afternoon and freshen up before going back to Disney parks later in day. You can actually see the firework show from the hotel balcany. Small swimming pool however majority of the time was empty as expected due to closeness of Disney parks. A wide selection restaurants within walking distance.   Car parking was free which was a bonus, handy to have a car in order to visit local supermarket & discount mall (about 5/10 mins away). If I ever go back I would definitely stay here as price was excellent for what we wanted.
Manager Response: I have to agree, our pool is not large but easily accommodates the needs of our guests.  It seems you all spend most of your time at the Disney Parks.  We look forward to seing next time you're in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Pretty basic but clean and well kept
Summary: The Best Western Anaheim Inn is perfect for a family stay at Disneyland. Now keep in mind, it's not The Grand Californian, but you also don't pay huge bucks. It's clean and very close to Disneyland. We felt safe and had a clean room that was nice. They offer a bit of a snack bag for breakfast which is a nice start to the day and you almost can't get any closer to the front gates of the parks. It is also right next door to a Denny's and a Tony Roma's with a Coldestone Ice Cream shop just a few more steps away. Also being so close to the parks, you can literally walk to Downtown Disney which has all sorts of shopping and restraurants in about 5 minutes. And it's walking through well lit Disney Property, not down shady city streets.  My family was pleased with our stay. There are
Manager Response: You are correct, we're not the Grand Californian but we do have clean rooms with a great location.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: We booked this hotel as it was very near Disneylands main entrance.  Great price - great location - comfortable rooms and beds - coffee in room and fridge and microwave!  Staff was wonderful and helpful - and they provided breakfast bags to go for those headed off to Disneyland! We will definitely book this hotel again next trip.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review.  I'm so happy that you were please with the Anaheim Inn, thank you for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Great Location, Great Service, Affordable, Basic
Summary: Our vacation was strictly to visit Disneyland & California Adventure Amusement Parks.  This hotel, although basic, couldn't have been located any better!  We were able to go back & forth throughout the day when necessary.  We have stayed at the Grand Californian & although it is fancy & expensive...the rooms are not much better than what you get here & it isn't any closer to Disneyland.  So...for the price savings, this was a great find & makes it a much more affordable trip.  The ladies at the front desk were very friendly & efficient.  It is directly next door to a Denny's and an IHop is just down the block so finding a place for breakfast was a non-issue.  If you want something fancy...this isn't it.  HOWEVER, it was more than adequate & I will stay here again.
Manager Response: I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay with us.  We hope to see you on your next trip to the "Parks"!

Summary: We are currently staying in the best western Anaheim inn and all we can say is eff the wifi! The rooms are alright but for the average pricing we would at least like to see queens. There are closer hotels that are cheaper with queens! We haven't been able to connect to the wifi our entire trip and frankly other than the location free wifi was the winning reason why we chose this location. Bad decision. Waking up with soar backs, air conditioning we had to fiddle with to get working, and no wifi. We've had an easier time connecting to the ramada wifi, which is next door. We will never be returning to this location continental breakfast or not. Btw breakfast in a big? The only reason we've learned about it is from readig reviews on this website! Bad form best western, bad form.
Manager Response: I'd like to start by apologizing for not living up to your expectations.  While the size of the beds and the "breakfast bags" may have been a misunderstanding, the problems you encountered with the wifi were not.  I'd like to discuss this further with you if you'd like to contact me or Sue Edwards here at the Anaheim Inn.

Summary Heading: Great location but that's about it
Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel and although it has a great location that's all it has going for it. The rooms are extremely dated and in need of an update; I felt like I was back in the 1980's. The beds were comfortable but small, only double beds. The wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling away and the toilet didn't flush very well. The first day I noticed one of the towels had a stain on it, the second day I used a facecloth and although it looked clean it has a hint of a vomit smell to it. Nasty!!! The rooms are small and there are no in room safes. The so call high speed WIFI they claim to have does not work so don't count on using that at all during your stay. Our room was on the lower level of the hotel and it was very noisy. We could constantly hear people opening and
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid comments.  I am so sorry you were not completly happy with your stay at the Anaheim Inn.  Had I known, I would have been happy to address your issues and resolved those we could.  I do hope your overall stay in Anaheim was a good, and that you will be back.

Summary: Stayed here on business for a week in March, 2013.  Rooms were very nice, clean and the location is perfect in regards to Disneyland.  Restaurants very close by, and can easily walk to Disneyland!  No issues staying here really at all, a very good, clean, comfortable stay.  Staff was very nice.  Parking is a little tight but that is the only issue I had and really no big deal at all.  Highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again.
Manager Response: I'm so glad you were able to mix pleasure with business, it would have been a shame to miss Disneyland when you were in the area.  Thanks so much for staying with us.

Summary Heading: A Great Choice for Disneyland Travelers
Summary: When I first heard that my friend had booked a Best Western for $139/nt + a $5/nt "resort fee" I wanted to throttle him. I thought this would be a total dump, as that's my normal experience with Best Western. However, when you consider how unbelievably expensive the 3 Disney hotels are and the general quality and price of the motels on South Harbor, then this place is a pretty great choice.  Rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping was very good. They put out nice breakfast bags each morning with a muffin, apple, bottled water, and granola bar. That was great if you are rushing to the parks in the morning and don't have time for breakfast.  Lana checked us in and offered right away to check our bags so we could go to the parks. She was very friendly.
Manager Response: I'm so glad you were happy with your friend's choice of where to stay.  I do hope you will be back to see us on your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary: Stayed here for a week - the front of the building was under construction and you would never know it by how they were prepared for it.  From check in to check out, everyone went out of their way to make sure we had an excellent stay and we certainly did.
Manager Response: As much as I'd like to take credit for your glowing review I can't, but will pass it on  to the Best Western Park Place Inn.  They are the ones under construction at this time.

Summary: Decided to go out on  a limb and book this Hotel. One, for the location and two, the price was decent. Won't do that again. If your expecting a breakfast that is in a bag and your wanting queen beds, Don't book here. Also when we went to get our car after a long day at Disneyland California Adventure...we were surprised to find a maintenance worker form the hotel was power washing the upstairs walkway debris onto all the cars that were parked below!!! The worst part was the managerial staff had nooo idea it was happening? So if your only going to book this hotel for it's location then it's all good....but that's pretty much it. Oh and theres a 5$ resort fee you have to pay cash for? Just not what it's for? Theres nothing resort about the hotel......breakfast is in a bag!
Manager Response: The Anaheim Inn does not have a breakfast at this time, but is offering  "breakfast snack bags" until our breakfast room is completed on early 2014.  I apologize for any misunderstanding.  We do take full responsibility for any problems resulting in the power washing that was done.  Please contact me with your concerns so that I can make it right with you.

Summary: This hotel is in a great location it took us literally 4-5 minutes to walk to the Disney gates. The room was excellent and very, very clean. The interaction with the staff was only on check in and check out and I would rate this as pretty average. In fact they just processed our booking and that was that! The breakfast in the restaurant next door was more than adequate with a great range of food to get you started for the day. The staff could be a bit happier as they looked like they were miserable and unapproachable!!!  We've stayed at four hotels so far in our trip and the Best Western rates as a 9 out of 10 for location and cleanliness. Thank you Best Western.
Manager Response: While I would love to take credit for your comments, I think you stayed at the Best Western Park Place Inn, not at the Best Western Anaheim Inn.  Their breakfast is served at Captain Kids, located next door to their property.  The Anaheim Inn will have a breakfast in early 2014.  I will pass your comments on to the Park Place Inn.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay if you are go to Disneyland Parks
Summary: This hotel is only a 7 minute walk to the park grounds.  It's right across the street from the Park extrance. Between Denny's and Toni Roma's for some inexpensive food.  Excellent place to stay if you have kids.  You can go in early and stay until the kids get tired the head back for a dip in the pool or a nap.  Then go back after a few hours and stay until closing.  I have stayed there tons of times and it's great.
Manager Response: Couldn't have said it better, thank you.  We should have you writng our Ads!

Summary: Best spot for Disneyland vacation, very clean, very helpful staff..... I was traveling in a very large SUV (not what i'm used to) and the maintenance man( Frank) helped me pull out of my parking space being that a truck across from me was parked very crooked and make it almost impossible to get out of the space...I always stay at BW Anaheim Inn...
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words, I'll let Frank know he's a star on Trip Advisor!

Summary Heading: Best  place to stay for disneyland adventure....
Summary: I love to stay at the Anaheim Inn ! My family and i visit Disneyland often and we always stay here. They are great, the staff is friendly  and its so close to the park you can walk.There are many different  places to eat close by so driving anywhere is not necessary.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for being a part of our "Anaheim Inn Family".  We enjoying seeing you and your family on a regular basis!

Summary: The hotel location may not be the nearest to the entrance of disneyland, they may not have the best parking space but the staff there are extremely friendly! We reached and were greeted warmly by their staff, the transaction took no longer than 3 min. Our room is directly above the reception. There is a elevator in the middle of the stretch just in case you have big luggages. We have nothing to complain about the room. It feels like home. Very comfortable and spacious and Great pillows just that the power sockets are a little far from the bed but not a problem at all. They also provide ticket for Disney except one day ticket pass. 24 hr restaurant just right beside the hotel. End verdict  Highly recommended.
Manager Response: I'm so glad you felt at home while staying at the Anaheim Inn, thanks for staying with us.

Summary: This seemed closer to the gates than the Disney hotel at the end of Downtown Disney.  There were so many reasonable food options along South Harbor Blvd within a steps of the hotel as well.   I loved that although they didn't have full breakfast yet (coming later this year) that they game out breakfast bags.  They were enough for my family of 4.   The people behind the desk were very kind and helpful, needed some directions to Post Office and some other info.  Room and beds were very comfortable and room had fridge.  If /when I come back to Disneyland, This is where I would stay. The only con was the parking lot was extremely tight, but it wouldn't stop me from staying there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments on your recent stay.  While parking is tight, we do have space for all our guests to park one car.  We look forward to seeing you when we complete our Breakfast Room in early 2014.

Summary: It is a short walk to Disneyland (which is nice when coming back at night) The room was very clean and check in was easy. The beds were comfortable. The walls are paper thin so you can hear everything
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you could hear your neighbors and apologize if it detracted from your stay.  I hope that you will give us another chance on you next visit to Disneyland

Summary: This was a very good hotel with the perfect location for our Disneyland visit. So convenient to walk across the street back to the hotel for nap time, change of clothes, etc. The hotel was clean, simple, and the pool was nice for dipping in and kid fun. It is much more reasonable than other spots with similar proximity to Disneyland. I am glad we did not have a car since we sure didn't need one to get to Disneyland and the parking at this place looked a bit daunting.  I would stay here again!
Manager Response: I have to agree, we do have a perfect location.  Thank you so much for staying with us, we hope to see you again.

Summary: Hotel staff and location were wonderful. Rooms were average, mattresses were very uncomfortable, woke up with a backache each day. Would not stay here again for that price, others in the area are much for comfortable for the price we paid.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments on your recent stay.  I'm sorry to hear that the Anaheim Inn wasn't everything you were expecting, but am happy to hear you liked our lacation and the staff.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: When we first pulled in the first thing I noticed was that the main parking area was narrow and only one lane. So if another car was coming down you were forced to park somewhere in order to let them pass. When we got into the room it was clean and the bed was nice and soft. They provided plenty of pillows. The closet was ikea quality at best and wouldn't even hold our suitcase. After we settled in we went out to dinner, came back and took a shower. That's when I noticed 3 dark long hairs that didn't belong to my husband (dark brown hair no longer then .5") or myself (2' long platinum blonde). It took 3 days before the maids cleaned them out. The shower head had poor pressure as well as the toilet. I had to move the clock over to the television to make room for my cell phone
Manager Response: I'd like to aplogize for not living up to your expectations.  Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using your feedback to implement improvements.  I hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a better experience.

Summary: We enjoy the location of this hotel, comfy beds very family friendly our favorite hotel for the price, locality, perks and price. Close to restaurants, within walking distance. Safe, fun and friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review.  I'm happy to hear you enjoyed all the Anaheim Inn has to offer.

Summary Heading: Great location from Disney, but poor Wifi connection
Summary: The Wifi connection would really really have to be improved.  We weren't able to get online 99% of the time during our 4 nights stay.  Not being able to connect to the Wifi is considered to a major disaster of the vacation.  For the breakfast, would be great if a simple continental breakfast with donuts/bagels/coffee/juice is available.  Nevertheless, no question about the great location from Disney, and you can actually see the firework from the site.  If there's 1 thing to choose for improvement, it would certainly be the Wifi connection.
Manager Response: My apologies  for the bad experience with the Wifi, we are trying to working out the problems so our guests have better service.  While we go through the process of adding our new breakfast room we are offering a "Brown Bag Breakfast Snack", I'm sorry if you missed them.  I hope you'll come back after the breakfast room is completed in early 2014.

Summary: Within walking distance of Disneyland -- highly recommend this general location.  I really don't remember much about this hotel except that we enjoyed it and the location was awesome.  We were only there one night -- 6 year old & mom -- so we didn't have time to try the pool.  If we had time for the pool, I would go back to the Ramada Maingate instead.
Manager Response: With Disneyland across the street we find most of our guests don't spend much time at the property.  Hope to see you on your next trip.

Summary: Stayed here for two nights with my husband for weekend getaway. Location to Disney and restaurants was great. We arrived late after a flight in from LAX check in was quick and pleasant. I have stayed at hotels where when you check in late they no longer have the room type reserved but this was not the case here.  Room was spacious, clean and bed comfortable and shower pressure great! They did not have a continental breakfast but they are in the process of building one however there was grab and go breakfast bags daily with fruit, water, granola bar and a muffin in it.  There was some noise from road (we were in room at front of building) but we just turned the fan on and it was fine. We would stay here again!
Manager Response: So glad you chose the Anaheim Inn for your weekend getaway, thanks for staying with us.

Summary: We've stayed at this hotel twice now when visiting Disneyland, and we will be back. Clean, quiet and well cared for. Heated pool is a great break in the middle of the day, I wished it opened earlier for a morning swim.   Breakfast would be a nice addition.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments regarding our great location, I have to agree it can't get much better.  I am happy to let you know we are in the process of adding a Breakfast Room that will be completed by the end of 2013 or early 2014.  We look forward to offering you breakfast on your next trip to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Great stay - fabulous location for walking to Disney
Summary: Clean, well kept room with two double beds.  Had no issues with noise (we were on top floor, near street).  Complimentary coffee, tea, microwave available.  Comfortable beds, plentiful pillows.  Small convenience store located behind (to the left when facing the Disney) is a good spot to pick up some breakfast/snack items for the room.  Also an apprx 5-min walk past here, two lights down, convenince store for better prices.    The air conditioner was only used for one day/night, and I found it hard to sleep with it on as it was quite loud.    Bagged snack items in a bowl in lobby for breakfast (a piece of fruit, small bottle water, muffin, granola bar).  Totally unexpected, and although this is not "breakfast" it was nice to have that snack to get you started or have on hand for
Manager Response: Again our apology for not telling you about the snack bags.  We'll be giving them out until our Breakfast Room gets built the end of this year.  We are in the process of replacing our old air conditioning units, a process that will also be completed by the end of the year.  I do hope you'll stay with us on your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary: Nice hotel, helpful staff and just minutes from Disneyland. Definitely would stay there again! Restaurants galore all literally within steps from the hotel. Much more cost effective than staying on site at Disneyland!
Manager Response: We look forward to you next trip to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: The only place I stay when we go to Disneyland!
Summary: We go to disneyland about once a month and we always stay here. We will not stay any where else. We love this hotel!!! Staff is so friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and perfect! You are right across the street for Disneyland. Prices are great!!!
Manager Response: We always enjoy seeing you.  Thank you so much for always staying with us.  See you soon!

Summary Heading: Great value hotel for Disneyland vacations!
Summary: We just returned from our 7th trip to Disneyland in the past 5 years. We  have stayed at several different hotels in the area and have always come back to the Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn. This hotel is the very best bang for your buck. The rooms have always been very clean and the staff have always been very polite and helpful. The internet and parking is free and they have on site and very reasonably priced guest laundry. The hotel is directly across the street from the parks which allows a quick return to the room to pick up sweaters or grab a quick lunch.  The rooms have both a microwave and fridge which have allowed us to save money on eating out and saved energy on those evenings when your too tired to go out for food.  The only negative is that the internet is very slow,
Manager Response: Thank you for your continued support.  Your comment regarding our our internet is valid and we are working on improving the service.  Hope to see you again some time this year.

Summary: We stayed at the Best Western Plus Anaheim Inn for 2 nights, as it was close to Disneyland.     I'll start off with the positives.  First, the hotel is very close to disney.  It's about a 3-5 minute walk to park entrance which is a great commodity, and probably the best attribute of the hotel.  The rooms were adequate and clean.  We had a room with 2 double beds, which we found comfortable.  They have free wifi, and free parking, which those can be tough to come by that close to Disney.      The cons:  We were told they had a free breakfast, which isn't entirely false.  However it was much different from what we expected.  They have a brown bag that you can pick up in the office that holds an 8 ounce bottle of water, a red apple, a granola bar, and a small muffin...hardly a true
Manager Response: I'd like to apologize for any misunderstanding regarding Breakfast.  The Anaheim Inn has never offered a breakfast, but we are going to build a Breakfast Room this year.  Until it is finished , we have started to offer a "Brown Bag Breakfast Snack".  I am sorry if you thought it was more than that.  I do hope you'll visit us again after we start serving breakfast.

Summary: As annual pass holders, we come to Disneyland often and have stayed at many hotels along Harbor and Katella.    We stayed at this hotel to celebrate my son's third birthday at Disneyland.  We arrived well before check in time on Saturday morning and had no problem finding a parking spot.  The front desk staff were extremely welcoming and let us check in and get a parking pass before heading to the park.  The location is excellent, right across the steet from the main gate.    We came back to the hotel for a break and to get our room keys.  We stayed in a king bed room which was handicap accessible.  The room, vanity and bathroom were large and clean.  The bed was comfortable for the three of us and we had plenty of space for our daughter's pack n play.    Overall, the location
Manager Response: We have a lot of Annual Passholders that stay with us, so glad we can add you to the list!  I hope we will be seeing you for your daughters birthday and your son's 4th.

Summary: I really enjoyed our stay at this BW. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The property is super close to the Disneyland crosswalk so taking breaks at the room during the day and walking back tired at night was no problem. The property is older and you see some wear and tear but overall it was clean and comfortable. The rooms have nice furnishings, a big 40 inch TV, fridge and microwave. The beds were very comfortable and the pillows and linens were of good quality.  Some people complain about the A/C but we had no problem with it at all. The fan wasn't too loud but it was just loud enough to drown out the noise other guests made. One thing the rooms could use is a fan in the bathrooms. Overall it was a very nice property.
Manager Response: You are correct, the Anaheim Inn will be 30 this year, but with the help of a great staff, we continue to offer clean comfortable rooms with a great location.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: We were very pleased with BW PLUS IN Anaheim. The only issues we had was there wasn't breakfast; however, they are in the process of building their kitchen. The rooms were super clean and the staff was very polite. Over all our experience was amazing.
Manager Response: Like you, we are looking forward to the addition of our Breakfast Room.  It looks like it will be completed by the end of this year.  Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Back again from a year ago.  We stayed for New Year's eve.  Location is walking distance  to Disneyland.  There are several BW in this area.  But we like coming here because this BW does not charge for parking.  Parking can fill up quickly here.  So it is best to check in early if you can.  One thing different from our prior stay was they now provide you with a breakfast brown bag  which consists of an apple, small granola bar, muffin and small bottled water.   We saved this bag for a snack and ate at the McDonald's down the street for breakfast.  It is nice that this BW is working on a breakfast room to be opened mid 2013.  Check in was pretty quick.  We had a room toward the back of the property, which we don't mind as it was very quiet back there.  WiFi worked great and it
Manager Response: It sounds like you rang in the New Year at Disneyland.  I do hope you will do it again this year when our Breakfast Room will be open.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: Stayed BWP on Dec 20. Check in was quick, friendly staff, and they let us check in an hour early.  Our room was large, clean and neat. We did not have a problem with the noise level. We were on the third floor room 311. Close to the elevator which was also quick we never had to wait. Breakfast room was under renovation so a small brown bag was available in the lobby. Had a small water, apple, muffin, and granola bar. That was fine but we look forward to the breakfast being back upon our next years visit. We will stay here again for sure. Location is great.
Manager Response: Glad to hear you enjoyed your recent stay.  Like you, we are looking forward to having our new Breakfast Room ready for your next stay!

Summary: In general our stay was very nice. Only complaint is that this hotel is very noisy; even late at night after Disneyland guests have settled in for the night. Why are people running up and down the hallways???
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear that you had a noisy stay.  While I don't have an answer to your question, my guest the running is do to overexcited children.  I do hope you will consider staying with us again.

Summary: Before my stay I had been worried that the room might be worn out as the Inn is so close to Disneyland and must surely see high occupancy. But I was very pleasantly surprised to find a spacious room that is simply spotlessly clean and stocked with more amenities than I expected.   The decor is not exactly modern but I assume it's an American thing as I see it in pricey luxury hotels in NYC too. This room and property is excellent for me personally as it has everything I need and does not have the frills I don't want to pay for. So what we appreciated that were provided are: large bathroom, good lighting, very clean and comfy beds, mini fridge, good tv ch selection, provision of cheap DIY laundry svc, spectacular proximity to Disneyland.   This property has just a small pool and
Manager Response: I'm so glad to hear that our rooms meet your expectations and the location worked for you.  We look forward to your return!

Summary: This hotel is super close to the Maingate, it made it very easy to access the Parks: very important w/a 4 and 2 year old and senior citizens! We got 2 adjoining rooms which made it convenient to 'share' space. The rooms were clean and basic, not super luxurious, but we were looking more for close, clean and economical (so we could spend more $ at the Parks). The pool is a little small, but still fun for the kids and clean. There are some close economical restaurants (McD's, Denny's, a little walk to Subway). You could go to close by mini marts for groceries or take a cab ($8-10 each way) to the closest grocery Supermarket. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear you enjoyed our location while visiting Disneyland with the little ones.  It sounds like you found everything you needed in the neighborhood.  Thank you for staying with us!

Summary Heading: Great location, good staff, beware of adjoining rooms
Summary: If you are going to Disneyland, it is hard to beat this hotel for location and overall value. That said, I am not sure I'd stay here again. Our room had doors connecting to both neighboring rooms. This may have seemed a good idea to the designers at the time, but it doubles the likelihood that those wanting a single room will be disturbed by noise seeping through the doors.  And unfortunately for my wife, two daughters, and me, one of the adjoining rooms was occupied by a family with 2 children who woke at 5:45 and cried non-stop for the next 4 (yes, really 4) hours.  This was torture as we were exhausted from a big day in the parks and going to bed at 1:00am. I'd only go back if I was assured of a room with only one door, connecting my room to the outside.
Manager Response: Because we have so many families traveling together, we do have many connecting rooms.  I'm sorry to hear your neighbors kept you up.  We'd be happy to put you into a room that doesn't connect on you next visit, just let us know when making your reservation.

Summary: We arrived at this hotel at 7am. We knew that we would not be able to check in but being right across the street from Disneyland, we wanted to know if we could at least get all the paperwork out of the way and park the car.  We were greeted by a very nice front desk agent who was more than helpful. She was able to help us get all of the check-in process taken care of and allowed us to park our car.  Parking is the only real "complaint" about this property. It is very tight and limited, but at least it is free.  Location is awesome. There is a Denny's diner right next door that had excellent service when we went and it is less than 5 minutes to walk and be at the Disney Entrance gates.  Our room was really nicely updated with all the amenities needed and comfortable bed.  Check
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay and our great location.  I agree, parking is tight but we do guarantee free parking for every room.  We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: This is our second stay at this hotel and we werent disappointed.  The positives are clean room, comfy bed.  Room has a Refrigerator, Microwave, Coffee pot.  Free parking.  Park and never have to move the car, because you are literally across the street from Disneyland.   The only negative is that the A/C unit is VERY loud.  I hadnt really noticed that during our first stay, but we did notice it this time.  Although after being at the parks everyday, we were pooped and sleep came pretty easy :)   This will be our `go to` hotel for Disneyland trips.
Manager Response: I'm so sorry to hear that you had a loud air conditioner.  We are in the process of replacing some of our old units with new ones, and would have been happy to look at your unit or would have even replaced it.    So glad to hear you'll be coming back, we look forward to it!

Summary: The Best Western 'Plus' Anaheim Inn is located right across from the Disneyland Entrance - excellent!  The staff from checkin to checkout and throughout your stay is friendly, helpful and welcoming. I've set the 'Plus' in quotes because compared to other BW Plus hotels I've stayed in throughout the west & Europe, the rooms have been exceptional. Do not expect these rooms to differ from an ordinary motel room, nothing a step up.  But considering they are clean, and have the regular amenities like a coffee maker, tv, wifi and that one spends little time in them, they do offer a clean bed & spot to spend the nights while maximizing your time @ Disneyland.  I've visited and stayed here twice and would not hesitate to again.  I like Best Westerns, get points towards free stays and
Manager Response: Thank you for your loyalty to Best Western.  You are correct, their Rewards program is great.  We look forward to you next visit.

Summary: Modern, with warm pool & hot tub, clean rooms, microwave, fridge, big TV, & very close to Disneyland, close enough to go back for a mid-day power nap.  Only noise is from discourteous neighbors.  Parking is tight, tub didn't drain well, & the bathroom smelled like cigarettes.  WI-FI password is where?  How do you dial the front desk?  Otherwise, a very nice hotel with only nit-pick types of annoyances.
Manager Response: Great feed back, thank you for sharing.  We need to know the good and the bad, and if you don't let us know we can't improve.  I am happy to hear that the good out weighed the bad and that you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: Hotel staff was coureous. Accomodating and pleasant. Room as always clean when we headed back for a break. Room was nice. Loved our Trip. The hotel was clean and the pool was great for the kids. Very clean and well maintained.
Manager Response: My staff and I are happy you were so pleased with you recent stay.  It's nice to hear that your family was able to enjoy our pool.

Summary: The hotel was wonderful. free Breakfast not worth going with small children. To many people and not enough room to sit.. Better off bringing you own food and eating it in your room. Location is the best...
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay, but it sounds like you stayed at our sister property the Best Western Plus Park Place Inn.  They have breakfast and we do not.  I'll be sure to pass on your comments to them.

Summary Heading: Awesome location for any trip to Disneyland
Summary: We wanted a place that was affordable, clean and close to Disneyland. This place delivers on all of that! It isnt fancy but fancy wasn't what we were looking for. Great location for trips to Disneyland, a mere few minutes walk over the road which you definately appreciate after spending a day at the majic kingdom and the staff were always happy and helpful.
Manager Response: You are correct, we do have one of the best locations in the Resort, and you know about our rooms on the third floor.  They truly do have a great view of Disney's fireworks!

Summary: As an annual pass holder I frequent Disneyland often with my family, and have stayed at several nearby hotels. This property is by far the best for location, its right across the street from the main entrance, but the room we stayed in wasn‚Äôt exactly the best. We stayed in the King Suite which resembled more of a mini apartment than a hotel room! The set up was great, it had one room with a queen bed and a fire place (although we didn‚Äôt use it) and a full size kitchen and table w chairs. The adjoining room was a standard room with 2 double beds and the bathroom located in this area. There is no parking fee which is great and overall the room was huge! The only concern was that it didn‚Äôt seem clean at all. There was an old, musty smell, as if the room isnt used very often and
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you were not happy with our Kitchen Suite.  It is our most popular rooms and is rarely empty but we do shampoo on a regular basis.  I'm sorry if you felt it was not up to your standards.

Summary Heading: Perfect family landing spot for Disney adventure
Summary: Though we've dragged the kids around the world on travel adventures, we'd never done the Magic Kingdom before. We joined up with extended family for a two day Disney trip and wanted a clean and convenient hotel close to the park. Best Western Plus did not disappoint and we were very grateful to be able to just walk across the street and collapse into comfortable beds after our long days in Disneyland. The rooms were slightly bigger than expected and we were happy to have a connecting room with grandparents. The microwave was an unexpected plus and the room was quiet except for the patter of happy I'm-going-to-Disneyland feet upstairs in the morning (not a problem--we were raring to go too). We ate at some of the chain restaurants that line the street (two are RIGHT next door)
Manager Response: I happy yo hear that you and your extended family had such a good time.  I have to agree the microwave is a nice plus.

Summary Heading: nothing fancy, but it's clean and right next to Disneyland!
Summary: My family stayed here for a weekend vacation at Disneyland.  We are two adult "kids" and our parents so we requested two adjoining rooms in a quiet location and the hotel staff accommodated our request.  We got the top floor, away from the street, and I highly recommend that as the street that goes past the hotel is very busy and also its an older hotel so I imagine the insulation is not great and it was nice not to "hear elephants" trodding overhead or cars going by at night.  Interesting to note that, though we technically had the same kind of room and paid the same price, the room our parents' got was bigger than ours. You might inquire when you book and make sure you are getting the bigger of the rooms if you are traveling with small kids and lots of luggage as every inch
Manager Response: Your are correct in saying that some rooms are larger than others.  It's actually every other room that is two feet wider.  I also have to agree with you regarding the trash truck.  We have tried to get the times changed but have had no luck.    I am glad you enjoyed our location and hope that you and your family will return next time you are visiting Disneyland.

Summary: This was 4th time staying here! perfect location, rooms are very claen staff awesome,rates are pretty reasonable for disney land. Definately recommend this hotel! 10 minute walk from front gate, this is one hotel that live up to its pictures that are posted for it. You have to book atransportation early for the airport.
Manager Response: I'm so happy to hear that we continue to live up to your expectations.  We look forward to you next visit.

Summary: We just can back from our trip Disneyland for 3 days I was a bit skeptical on this hotel however the reviews sold me! On our arrival the the front desk greeted us and was amazing fast check in! We were in the 3rd floor (our preference) the room was just as the pictures very very clean nice bedding lots of towels pillows blankets we had a mini fridge, microwave & coffee maker in our room! I can't complain the only down fall is the beds are twin beds wich are a bit smaller but we were only in our beds to sleep in at night we were there for Disneyland not hotel! So overall I have to say I was beyond satisfied it's a 5 min walk to the Disneyland gates soooo close perfect for my 3 yr old daughter!! I would recommend this hotel book it!!
Manager Response: While our beds are double, not twins, they can seen small when you are used to a much larger bed at home.  I do hope you weren't too uncomfortable.  I'm happy to hear you were pleased overall with your stay.

Summary: It's easy to spend a fortune at Disney.  Staying at this place helped reduce the cost.  The rate was moderate.  There are fridges and microwaves in the room that allowed us to buy food and make it ourselves.  You can park a single car without additional cost.  It's right across the street from Disney so no transportation costs are incurred.  This is not a fancy hotel and that worked perfectly for us.
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear you utilized the fridge and microwave in the room.  It truly does save on eating expenses, especially when there are so many other places to spend it in Disneyland!

Summary: We arrived here early and were pleasantly surprised to be told our room was available. The apples available at reception are a nice touch.Staff here were so friendly and helpful. Rooms were lovely and clean. Housekeeping called to check if we needed extra towels when we requested no service which was fantastic. Location is amazing as it is literally steps away from Disneyland's main entrance.
Manager Response: We're always happy to get our guests checked in early if the room is available, I'm happy to hear we were able to do that for you.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: A great place to stay when visiting DL. Very close to DL entrance. Rooms are smallish but do the job - you are after all, only there to sleep. The pool area was a hit with the kids; nothing fancy, but a spa and a pool you could have fun in. The staff were very helpful and responsive to all and any queries. Top marks for allowing us to put aside our luggage after checkin so that we could visit DL on our last day and then wait for our transfer at 6pm. I would not hesitate to stay again.
Manager Response: I'm so glad everything worked for you and your family here at the Anaheim Inn.  Hope to see you on your next trip to the States!

Summary Heading: After tons of research, this paid off
Summary: I spent hours and hours researching the best spot to stay for a Disneyland vacation (online, disneyland books, message boards and more) looking for a walking distance hotel with good rates.   I was very, very happy with our choice.  So close we couldn't believe it, and the place was clean and comfortable.  A lot of the hotels on this strip go for gimmicks or add things like convenience stores that might make money, but these hurt the customer experience.  This place concentrates on being a hotel and that's it.  No breakfast, but for the rate and considering they have refrigerators and microwaves, no problem.  Kind and helpful staff.  I would stay here again, absolutely.  Did I mention the location?
Manager Response: I'm so glad you found us, and were happy with your choice.  I hope to see you on your next trip to the Disneyland area.

Summary Heading: Nothing fancy here, it just works
Summary: This is a fabulous location for Disney goers (right across the street from the gate), but DH and I weren‚Äôt there this time to go into the Park.  Just park your car and walk it.   Nothing real fancy here, but it‚Äôs clean, nice sized room, comfortable beds.  We had a coffee maker, micro and mini fridge, so we had some supplies with us rather than spend a small fortune on eating out for every meal, it can be pricey. You can walk just about anywhere you want to go to in the area, loads for places to eat. The kicker for us was the Friday night fireworks display over Sleeping Beauty‚Äôs castle.   Ask for a room on the third floor so that you can watch it, without paying for it!
Manager Response: I'm so glad you were able to see the firework display from our third floor.  We have a lot of return guests asking for that location, and I guess we'll be adding you to that list.  See you soon.

Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and it was ok. The parking is tight and the beds were ok. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location. And I think it is incredibly overpriced considering how outdated this hotel is. I would stay here again but just because it is so close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your candid comments.  I understand we can't be everything to everybody, but am happy you liked our location and would return when visiting Disneyland.

Summary: Went to this Best Western for over-night trip to Disneyland. We stayed in the suite with 3 double beds. Room was very clean. Usually my allergies act up at hotels, not here. Loved the extra space in room. And Disneyland very close. A couple of draw-backs, the parking is AWFUL. Tight spaces and very limited. Also, try to avoid rooms near stairs and street. Was noisy at times. But over-all would recommend.
Manager Response: We are aware parking can be tight, but we do make sure that every guest has a spot.  I am glad to hear you enjoyed one of our suites.  They're great for larger families or if you just need more room.  I hope to hear from you the next time you visit the Anaheim area.

Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights while visiting Disneyland. I was pleasantly surprised! The beds as pillows were very comfortable, the room was clean, and the hotel was in such a convenient location. The price is excellent for what you get! I was expecting much less for the price. We will definitely be back when we visit Anaheim next
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review of the Anaheim Inn.  Please call me when you are coming back so that I can personally make your reservation.

Summary: This is a good value motel conveniently right across the street from Disneyland.  The rooms were spotlessly clean and the beds very comfortable, which is all you need if you are coming here for a trip to the Magic Kingdom. It only takes moments to walk to the park entrance.  With so many other accommodation choices in this area it can be hard to choose the right place to stay. We looked online at comparative websites before we arrived and thought that the price was competitive and given the location was a reasonably good value choice. This motel has a small swimming pool and Jacuzzi which is a nice distraction.  No breakfast included but with a Dennys just next door - who cares.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the Anaheim Inn, I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay.  You mentioned that Breakfast would have been nice, well I have some good news for you.  We hope to introduce a  Breakfast by the start of next summer.  I do hope you'll be back to experience it.

Summary Heading: Fine for a trip to Disney
Summary: Ideal if you are just planning to visit Disney as it is literally right across the road. Easy access to some good places to eat (and the ice cream served a couple of doors away is delicious). Due to the location it was very busy during our visit and as a result could be quite noisy at night and in the morning.  The car park also got quite full quickly.  The a/c wasn't that effective and looked like it needed a good service but the room was clean.
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that your air conditioner wasn't as efficient as it should have been, please accept my sincere apology.  I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay here in Anaheim, and our wonderful location.  I have to agree the ice cream is wonderful.
