Thank you so much for staying with us, we hope you will return when you come back to the States.

Summary: Listen, I only had time for a quick review of the hotels in this area for a 1 night stay prior to arriving Disneyland and I couldn't be more pleased with this hotel...thanks to my Trip Advisor friends giving on point ratings! First, the price was VERY reasonable and it was literally RIGHT across the street from the Disneyland entrance! Make sure you book the right BW+ by the way, as there are two within a mile from each other (verify address).  The front desk staff was great and they were also very knowledgeable about the area as I needed to find out where to eat and get a few other things taken care of.  The hotel is also within walking distance to a little mall with places to eat and shop (as well as Downtown Disney) if you need handy nearby things.   Even though the hotel is
Manager Response: I'm so happy you enjoyed your stay at the Anaheim Inn, but was sorry to hear that you had to make your own bed after a long day at Disneyland.  Please accept my apologies.  When returning to Anaheim, please give me a call so that I can personally make your reservation.

Summary: Have stayed here for the past 2 Disney Half Marathons in Sept over the Labor Day Weekend.  Have make reservations for the Tinker Bell Half Marathon in Jan. 2013.  When we come we reserve up to 4 rooms with 10 to 12 adults.  Everyone is friendly, rooms clean and the best part is..... Right at the main gate to Dland and California Adventure.  Discounts to Denny's next door.  This is a perfect place for everyone.  The price is right too.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying at the Anaheim Inn for another Disney Marathon.  We sure enjoy hosting so many of the participants, and were so happy when they added the Tinker Bell Marathon this year.  Looking forward to seeing you and your family again in January!

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for 5 days for Disneyland and it was very convenience.  The location is perfect, and staff is friendly.  We went in the park early and came back to hotel to rest when people were starting to come in around noon.  However the TV in the room is broken, and they couldn't fix it for whatever reason.  Not that it's a big deal but kind of annoying.  I would def. go back again if I were to visit Disneyland again, but would make sure the TV works.
Manager Response: I'd like to apologize to you and your family for the TV not working, there is no reason that it could not have been repaired or replaced during your stay.  I am happy to hear that you enjoyed the rest of the stay and hope that you will stay with us again on your next trip to Disneyland. I guarantee that your TV will work!

Summary: We have stayed at the Bestwestern twice now and each time we have been able to check in early, which is much appreciated after a 13 hour flight from Australia. This place is reasonably priced and right across the road from Disney. Because we know how close it was I tried to book in through the actual accommodation site and it was booked out. I then went to google maps to try and find another hotel close and by accident clicked on Bestwestern it showed availability so I booked through google maps at the same price. Lucky. The staff are always helpful and the rooms are clean, will not disappoint.
Manager Response: I'm so glad you found us, even if it was by accident.  We're the lucky ones, thanks for staying with us.

Summary: This hotel does exactly what it says on the tin. Right opposite Disney gates, clean, comfortable beds and friendly staff.  This is more a motel than hotel, no bar, restaurant or lounge area but rooms are great value and we made use of the pool for an hour or two to get out of the parks in the afternoons and were mostly on our own in the pool.  The are plenty of eateries but these are of the low budget, Amercian diner type places like Denny's etc.   Would stay again if we visit Disney CA again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review.  We do pride ourselves on our location, clean rooms, and friendly staff.  We hope to see next time you're in the States.

Summary: We just returned from a 4 night stay at this motel and it was wonderful. It is just across the street from the parks, and there are resturants all around it. We were a party of 7 and everyone was able to come and go as they pleased without having to worry about getting confused, pretty much a straight shot from the motel to the gate. The only cons I have about this hotel were the parking...it is very tight, especially if you are driving a van, witnessed more than a couple of almost accidents when people were pulling out. I also didn't like that we were a party of 7, using 3 rooms and we couldn't have any adjoining rooms, or rooms close by. One of the rooms wound up being in the second building on the 3rd floor, and the other rooms were on the 2nd floor of the first building down
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  You are correct in saying that parking is very tight.  I wish it weren't true but it is.  I am concerned to hear that your party was separated, I am so sorry.  We try very hard to get families together, we're we aware of the situation?  If you and your family plan to return to Anaheim, please give me a call so that I came make sure all of your rooms are together.

Summary Heading: Cheap motel for your Disney trip
Summary: This place is great for family Disney trip. It is right across the street from Disney. It has two connected room sleeps 5 people. For the money you pay for, it is a good value.   The free breakfast is not the greatest, it goes out pretty fast and did not get refilled right away. The lady work there gave me a look when I took a second piece for my daughter. I guess I got what I paid.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good if you just need a place to sleep
Summary: This motel has a great location.We walked right to Disneyland. The reservation and check in were smooth. The room was fairly clean but could have been cleaner. It was also in need of refurbishment which might have led to the feeling that it could have been cleaner. The bed wasn't horrible but wasn't great either. It reminded me of the motels I stayed in with my parents as a kid.  The big problem is the parking. We got the last spot of parallel parking (the regular spots were full too.) It wasn't very close to the room but could have been a lot farther. We parked when we checked in and didn't move the car until we checked out after spending two nights. We were afraid to lose the spot. But we were just there to go to Disneyland, so it wasn't a big issue.  Overall, the location was
Manager Response: While I know that we can't be all things to everyone, I am happy to hear that you wouldn't be opposed to staying with us again.  Parking is tight here at the Anaheim Inn but we do guaranty a spot for every guest room. I'm sorry to hear that you were concerned  you might lose it if you had left the property.  I hope you'll consider staying with us again.

Summary Heading: A great hotel for Disneyland trip
Summary: We went to Disneyland with extended family in January. It was our first time visiting the parks and had no idea where to stay. I'm really glad that we chose this one. The rice was unbeatable. The location was perfect. Even though it is an older building - our room was very large. We had a connecting room to family and we could all easily fit on the one room at the end of the evening. It was less than a blocks. walk to the main entrance. We shut the parks down every night and the kids (4 & 9) had no trouble walking back to the hotel. Even forgetting something in the room didn't pose a problem - it was easy to run back and get it. It was also great that we were surrounded by all kinds of restaurants and a convenience sotre which hd some fun Disney stuff too. Denny's was open 24
Manager Response: none

Summary: This motel couldn't have been more perfect for our Disney stay!  The beds are great, and the room was very clean.  Nice refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker in the room.  Also, the rooms were pretty quiet. Very little noise from other guests.  I used the laundry room, and I was pleasantly surprised to find it spotless.  The staff were very accommodating and even offered quarters for machines if we needed them.  No, there's no restaurant, but I can see why:  There's food all around!  And since we knew the motel doesn't haven a restaurant, we brought plenty of snacks, fruit, and bottled water with us.  You can tell that these motels are very limited on space, and this one has maximized theirs to provide great rooms and free parking.  Yes, the pool is small, but we really
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great spot for a Disneyland visit!
Summary: Let me start by saying if you are looking for a resort experience, spend the money and stay on Disney property.  This hotel does not have a restaurant or lounge, or chairs outside the room to relax, and the pool is very small.  Most homes have larger pools, if there are 4 people in there it is crowded.  Now having said that, if you are looking for a nice place to sleep, and are going to spend a maximum amount of time in the park, I can't think of a better place to stay.  You are directly across the street from the entrance, in fact their lot is closer than the Disney employee lot (and parking is free).  The hotel is VERY clean, and the front desk is super nice and helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Fantastic location if visiting the Disneyland area. Clean and reasonably tidy Motel but a shame that the lift was out of order, would have scored them a point higher if we didn't have to walk up the stairs after walking around the parks all day. Asked the cleaning staff a question but they could speak English. On a whole worth the money we paid.
Manager Response: I'd like to apologize for an out of order elevator.  To my knowledge it's been down only once this summer and was repaired within two hours. Unfortunately it was during the time you and your family needed to use it, I am sorry.  I am happy to hear the rest of your stay was good.  Please give us a call the next time you come to the States.

Summary: We spent five nights here and did not have a problem with anything. We had four adults in the room so next time I will get queen beds as doubles were a bit small, my fault not there's. The staff were great expeacialy Elizabeth. The pool was nice and never very busy. There was no breakfest here but IHOP, Dennys, Tony Roma's and a couple of other restaurants are all right there. They have laundry machines and Internet as well as a computer you can use if needed. We loved the location it is right across the street from the main entrance to both parks. It takes about 5 to 10 min to get to the gates but it doesn't matter we're you stay you can't get much closer. We liked the fact we could go to the parks and then return to our room for a rest if we wanted. We will deffanatly stay
Manager Response: I'm so happy to hear you had such a pleasant stay at the Anaheim Inn.  You are correct, we do have a great location.  Elizabeth as well as the rest of the staff was delighted to be mentioned in your review, thank you.

Summary Heading: Good hotel in a great location.

Manager Response: Thanks so much for staying with us on your recent trip to the Disneyland Resort.  I was sorry to hear that the pool was so busy when you were here but it's a popular place on those hot summer days.  I do hope we'll see you on your next trip!

Summary: I have been staying at this property for over 7 years, almost every 3 months. ( We are annual pass holders). The staff is always friendly, and accomodating. The rooms are always clean. Wifi hasn't been the greatest, but on this last visit, was greatly improved. It is the only place we will stay when doing Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your loyality.  We've been working on the Wifi, I'm so glad to hear it was working better for you.  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: This was our first time staying at this hotel.  I would have to say we were VERY satisfied with it.  The rooms arent fancy, but were clean and comfortable.  The staff was nice and helpful and although parking was tight, there was free parking available for guests.  Basically we parked our car and never got back into it until we left 3 days later.  It is located next door to a Denny's restaurant and is just steps to the intersection where you cross to get to the Disneyland/California Adventure parks.  We were on the third floor towards the back end of the hotel, but we were able to see the majority of the fireworks coming from the park in the evening.  We will stay here again for sure !

Summary Heading: The best place for the best rest!

Summary: Great location. Helpful and friendly staff. Great location and hotel for my daughter and I. Upper floors are non smoking and pretty quiet for a hotel full of people with excited children! They sell Disney tickets too.

Cable TV channel seclection was better than average.  Beds were extremely comfortable, made up with well-kept linens. Free wireless internet was available and worked throughout my stay.  Housekeeping was efficient, cleanliness of the room was good.      Of note was the exceptional customer service received at the front desk.  Check-in and check-out were incredibly simple. Nothing special about the room or hotel, other than it was quiet, convenient and a good value -- oh, and the mattress and pillows were quite comfortable. Summary Heading: Alright to stay if you are only sleeping there.

It did not offer a breakfast but I searched extensively for the most inexpensive place closest to the park and this is what I got.   Next time I will probably try the Carousel or Fairfield Inn, since they are comparably priced in the same location and looked a bit nicer.

Summary Heading: Perfect Value for a Disneyland Trip
Summary: When visiting Disneyland, you have numerous choices of hotels for your stay. In addition, if you have a car, you get free parking included.  The rooms themselves are definitely very simple, but they are clean and functional.  The bed is comfortable and the sink being outside the bathroom is helpful for saving time in the morning for one person can shower while another uses the sink.  The one negative about the room is that there is no safe in the room.  They do advertise that there is a safe to keep your valuables in

Summary: Older motel, but great location for Disney, Tony Roma's and a Denny's just next door.  Just a few blocks from Convention Center, Bubba Gump's, and staff is cheerful/friendly. I left my business portfolio on top of my car in the parking lot and another guest turned it in to the office. They had to do some gumshoe detective work, as all it had was a fed ex invoice to give them a clue to who owned it, and a call came through from the front desk telling me they had it for me to retreive and my convienience.

Summary: This motel provides very basic accommodation at a modest price. Rooms are date and small. The reason to choose this hotel is proximity to Disney, it is right across the street.   There is no free breakfast here.   Internet and parking are included so it represents good value.

Summary: With the exception of one or two other hotels, you can't get much closer to the entrance of Disneyland. Summary: We stay here for 5 nights , great location and the price was great. Rooms were cleaned everyday and clean towels .

Eating places (fast food perhaps, but it's Disneyland and high traffic even off the site means fast food) are plentiful and Tony Roma's ribs are welcome! Value for money is outstanding, location to die for and staff very welcoming. Don't hesitate to book in here if you're on a Disney vacation.

Summary: We stayed there 2 nights while visiting Disneyland. It's just 5 mins walk across to Disneyland and California Adventure. Very convenient.  Room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom had a bath-tub and good design of drawing shower curtains. You'll probably spend very little time in the hotel other than when the park closes at 8 or 9. After walking so much in the park, it is relaxing to take a dip in the heated pool and jacuzzi which opens till late.  There's Denny's, IHOP and Tony Romas within walking distance.. but while we were there Dennys was under renovation. So we didn't have much choice for dinner other than eat at Tony Romas. Summary: This hotel, along with a few others on Harbor Blvd. is in an ideal location. Summary Heading: It really depends on what you're looking for
Summary: This place was okay, but nothing special. It was a pretty good bargain because it was so close to Disneyland. The room was clean, but the location was very noisy as all rooms lead to an outdoor walkway which is used by everyone going to and from their rooms to the the pool, etc. and there were a lot of excited children running around. If that kind of noise doesn't bother you and you don't mind a slightly small room, then it's a good place to stay. If you're looking for something more upscale, this is not the place to stay.

Summary: Stayed here March '04. The room was clean and comfortable, and the location could not be beat! There was minimal noise, just what you would expect from exteror corridors. 3 of the 4 in our group are light sleepers, and we all slept well. Our only complaint was the pillows - too thick and hard. But we got thinner ones when we asked for them.  Just a short walk to the parks, and also to Mimi's, our recommendation for breakfast and dinner, as the prices and food were better by far than IHOP. We would be likely to stay here again.

Summary: This was a great hotel if you plan to be at the parks most of the day.  The room was very clean, and spacious, and reasonably priced. We will definately stay here again!
